沉浸感。无言并没有营造出足够的沉浸感，也没有暗藏的深刻剧情，仅仅只是hob不需要文字罢了。
音乐。没有bgm。
解谜。本应挑起大梁解谜，却意外的简单，没新意。甚至就是一个找路-按机关-找路的循环。

只有画面还不错，能接受这种大色块的风格的话，hob确实能给你带来足够的视觉享受，原始与科技融合的异星风景确实让人着迷，拨开机关后地形、建筑刷刷地变化感觉也很酷。
so，hob其实是一个看风景的休闲游戏，冲着解谜之类的要素来玩恐怕会失望。

35703079.review: Not posting a full blown review yet this is just from about an hour in and I must say this game is absolutely gorgeous so far. The atmosphere is astonishing,controls are great, the ambient music and sound effects pull me into it too. No narative at all but there is definately a story here. The design so far is astounding and the world and visuals are just plain pretty to look at. I will update with a full review once I finish it but I already recommend this game.

35702755.review:
Great game, good balance between solving puzzles and a focused linear experience.

While this is nothing like old-school adventure games with puzzles, in that they puzzles are pretty straight forward, it still captures a lot of the feel of discovery. Theres some satisfaction finding out how to reach certain locations to get the hidden items, but it never feels like you have to wander aimlessly forever, although I understand some people will see that as a weakness of the game.

The combat is a little weird for my tastes, doesnt feel responsive or "snappy" its a little "loose" if that makes any sense, that feeling also extends to other game mechanics like some of the plataforming parts, and other parts where the game feels a little buggy like getting stuck on some geometry or spazing out between some bushes.

I question the choice of camera perspective a little bit, doesnt seem ideal for this type of game, althought they clearly took measures to minimize the problems caused by it (jumps correct the angles if youre a bit off, and you can only fall off ledges if youre sprinting).

A lot could've been done to improve the world map, its already been said but theres no indication of dungeon entrances, I had to look at a map someone made.

Just be prepared to face some sort of glitch (hopefuly you won't, there are't too many), personally I was hit by an enemy while collecting a butterfly, the thing then became un-interactive but I didn't get it, makeing it impossible for me to 100% the game, since im missing 1 butterfly even though I uncovered all the map.

Those problems didn't prevent me to have a blast playing Hob though; watching the world assmble piece by piece and then exploring those places, or the new places formed by a part you previously explored and the new part is great fun.

I would say of you want a zelda-like experience pick this one up, even if its not 'a link to the past', its still an excelent game with a GREAT value (its 20$ but it really feels like a 30$ game).

35699395.review:
I have not yet finished Hob, but I have played about 8 hours at this point, and I feel very compelled to review it. I don't post a lot of Steam reviews, but for a gem like this I feel like I want everyone to know about it. It's SUCH a crowded year in gaming in 2017, and I fear amazing smaller games like Hob are going to get completely overlooked. But I'm considering putting this in my top five this year, and I've played nearly everything across handhelds, PC and consoles. It's just that good.

Hob is being described by many as something like the old top-down Zeldas. But it's much more complex in its RPG elements and combat, and perhaps a little less complex in its puzzle solving and dungeon-ing. Yes, it's linear, but I like that I'm constantly being pulled along and discovering new areas. There are plenty of little hidden upgrades and things for those who want to go the extra mile figuring out how to get to every little area.

What initially sold me on Hob was its beautiful, colorful art style. But the gameplay is keeping me thinking about this game even when there are much bigger titles out there like Shadow of War out right now. I just love Hob.

Two things it could use: More story elements. And fewer bugs -- I've encountered a few 'stuck' moments that required me to reload the game. Hopefully those will get patched out soon, but they are no reason not to play the game because it has frequent save points that automatically save when you walk past them.

35698862.review:
这是一款开放世界的冒险解密游戏，总体来说是一款美术带节奏的游戏，玩法上的设计亮点并不多，所以不推荐对玩法要求很高的玩家入手，但对于喜欢探索尝鲜和欣赏风景的玩家来说绝对不能错过。
 [h1]优点：[/h1]
+美术表现优秀，无论是光影还是色彩都属于上乘之作，异世界卡通美术风格非常统一，游戏中的一草一木都异常贴合游戏整体的世界观，合理却充满想象。
+操作体验优秀，包括战斗在内的交互反馈做的都非常成熟，人物的动作表现生动自然，UI动画简洁而不简单，事件反馈流畅不拖沓。
+优秀的战斗系统，攻击，防御，翻滚，闪避，穿梭，蓄力，盾反，跳劈，砸地，硬直，该有的战斗体验一应俱全。配合亮眼的武器设定，机械手臂功能十分强大强大，可以作为攻击武器，也可以化为盾牌，可以作为机关触发器，还可以用于地形位移（类似尼禄的鬼手）
+箱庭式的关卡设计，"箱庭"一词其实最早源于宫本茂的箱庭设计理论，游戏的开放式关卡设计也是基于这个理论来设计的，每次走到下一处地点都会给人眼前一亮的感受，心中不由念一句卧槽。
+动态的场景设计也为游戏加分不少，即开启某些机关后现有的场景结构会发生改变，扩展了解谜元素的设计维度，同时给玩家带来巨大的视觉震撼。
 [h1]缺点：[/h1]
-几乎没有指引，前两个小时我几乎一直在问自己，我是谁，我从哪里来，要到哪里去，游戏提示不够明确导致玩家目标感不强，一旦玩家失去目标感，很容易让玩家产生焦躁的情绪。
-优秀的战斗系统没有与之相符的敌人来衬托，游戏中除了几场战斗外其他战斗均是点缀，可有可无，完全没有打他们的欲望，唯一的理由是获得碎片升级武器，但升级武器又没有什么实质性的作用，因为怪物的难度等级并不明显，即使不升级武器也能打过。
-鸡肋的成长系统，除手臂外的技能成长完全可以不要，玩家完全没有想要成长的欲望，费劲收集了断刃来升级剑，结果就只是提升少许伤害，毫无诚意，其实这点的原因还在于关卡中的冲突元素设计的不够系统，感觉敌人和战斗系统是分开设计的，基本没有关联。
-无对白剧情，虽然现在都流行走无对白式的高大上叙事路线，但游戏的叙事方式真的太粗暴，直接用角色动画和场景元素的形式来引导玩家和交代剧情，如果放在传统的现代题材游戏玩家很容易理解，但放在异世界带有幻想色彩的游戏中还需要更多的尝试。
-游戏的音乐几乎没有，但环境音做的很棒，如果到指定情节加入相应情感的音乐，对玩家理解剧情和增加代入感都会有很大的帮助。

*惊喜：[spoiler]双结局，根据玩家的选择会有两种结局供玩家选择，一种代表同化，一种代表救赎，升华了游戏的立意。[/spoiler]

总结：一款具有独特艺术气质的诚意之作，游戏的探索体验相对亮眼，但在其他玩法设计方面还有所欠缺。

 [h1]评分：6.5/10[/h1]

35680775.review:
Very awesome game. reminds me of the old 2D Zelda games, with better combat, and the art style is reminiscent of a game called, 'Spiral Knights.'
I'd suggest this to pretty much anyone. It doesn't seem to have an age limit, really... anyone with hand-eye co-ordination will do. :D

Some cons would be that; it can get a little buggy in the areas where the ground is uneven and, even with a map, it can kind of be confusing as to where you should be going (So basically hard to follow a linear progression, which isn't specifically a bad thing just harder to figure out where to go). One last con would be that there's very little replay value, just 'collect-a-thon' achievments and some 'garbs' for different play styles. A new game + (peranently lock on very hard mode maybe even?) would be awesome in my opinion.

I played on hard difficulty, with the purple 'Dynamo' garb on that cuts you health in half, and found the game pretty easy, because of the constant supply of healing items. Maybe if they make a second HOB, or similar game, they'll give you less healing items from the ambient environment.

Last words would be: I hope this development team makes another game, because that was really fun! I think I might replay the game with the green 'spirit' garb on very hard difficulty, just to make my own kind of new game +/ Speed run mode.

Несмотря на то, что везде рекомендуется контроллер, играла клавомышью и все было нормально. Не ожидала наличие двух концовок в игре и возможность выбора. Историю разжевывать вам не будут, нужно додумывать самому.

35662671.review:
这是一款制作十分用心的游戏，包括地图的设计和别具一格的画风都能够让人感受到这一点。

但我坚持不推荐，因为用心不代表它好玩。

首先这是一款偏解密探索的游戏。
但偏偏解密部分十分简单，解密成功后我个人并没有获得一丁点的满足和惊喜，脑海里只剩下“MD我又要开始乱窜了"的念头。
玩家的大部分时间都花在寻找谜题上，而在寻找的过程中玩家并没有办法感受到探索的乐趣。
以上这两点很好笑，在我看来这是一种设计缺陷。

游戏的战斗部分，我不知道怎么去形容，总觉得它可有可无，在这个游戏里我没有任何想要变强的欲望。你会发现搜集剑的碎片这种事仅仅是因为你想要完成所有成就，而并非它能让你变强。

这个游戏没有任何的文字和引导，事实上我并不觉得这个做法有什么问题。
但当BGM极其没有存在感的时候，问题就非常致命了。

玩家没有任何沉浸感！！！没有任何沉浸感！！！沉浸感！！！ 这很重要。
（大家可以去参考《奥日与黑暗森林》《空洞骑士》这两个非常优秀的典型，完美的BGM所带来的效果。）

在游戏的开头几小时内，你不知道故事背景，你不知道你的目的是什么，你始终在思考我是谁？我在哪？MD我怎么又回来了？
游戏体验极其糟糕，在配上那完全没有存在感的BGM后，你会深深的感受到煎熬。

但优点不是没有，68的亲民售价。
如果你喜欢简单解密并且时间实在多到不知道怎么用，相信它可以成为你的休闲杀时利器。

总体不推荐，4/10。

35662638.review:
Highly recommended!

Play Hob if you like adventure games told purely via visual storytelling where there's no dialogue (that can be understood at least), where you're put in a world of ancient machinery. Has a lot of similarities in feel to Legend of Zelda, Ico, and Hyperlight Drifter. If you love turning cranks, inserting power cubes, stone doors opening, discovering collectibles in little nooks of the map, and also some light combat to round it out, PLAY THIS.

I love games where you can seamlessly explore and unlock an entire world. There are loading screens for exterior to interior transitions, but in the main world map you're never stopped to wait for a loading bar to finish.

There are indicators for where you should go next, but none of it hits you in the face unless you've opened the map. Even the menus have no language in them (except for essentials like settings, and tutorial prompts). The delight of exploration, and uncovering new areas is sooooo much fun!

I ran into framerate issues here and there, but the game was so much fun to play, I didn't care. Occasionally the camera angle made platforming difficult (especially deciding which way to point the thumbstick when hanging from edges), but again not a dealbreaker. If the thought of framerate drops makes you want to gouge your eyes out, this might not be for you, but I think you'll be missing out.

35657585.review:
Редкий гость на пк, экшен-приключение. В котором все хорошо, кроме того, что игра скучная. Я, как бывший приставочник, избалован хорошими играми этого жанра и могу себе позволить оставить отрицательный отзыв. Почему же он - отрицательный? Скука и неопределенность. У игры и так много положительных отзывов, пускай будет и мой - отрицательный.

Приятно исследовать, находить тайнички, решать несложные головоломки. Но делать это скучно. У вас мало причин, чтобы идти вперед. Главная и основная - вы купили игру и хотите в нее поиграть. 

Вам ничего не объясняют, приходится только гадать о том, что это за герои на экране, чего не так с этим миром и какого вообще фига тут происходит. Вот вы ходите, качаетесь, получаете новые способности и применяете их... Но меня коробит отсутствие мотивации. Идти убивать местных жителей (их же реально много там, скорее всего они тут живут), валить их потому, что некий огромный робот махнул в ту сторону рукой... Такая себе мотивация. Хоть бы, ну не знаю, принцессу в другой замок спрятали, что-ли... Есть же все задатки для сюжета. Класные зайцептицы - тоже есть.

У меня процесс прохождения вызывал мысли о том, что я сделал какую-то непонятную хрень и теперь происходит какая-то другая непонятная хрень. Нафига? Ну, дверку открыть жи! Неужели нельзя было добавить хотя бы текстов (фиг с ней, с дорогой озвучкой)? Чобы появился хоть какой-то смысл в происходящем...

Это я описал свою главную претензию. Кроме этого, пару раз сталкивался с проблемой того, что смог пролезть в некую зону, выйти из которой - не могу, и дальше пройти - не могу. А почему так произошло? Я искал секретики и пролез туда, куда не должен был. По сюжету туда еще рано, нужно сначала получить способность... Стал относиться к поиску секретиков осторожнее.

Вот как-то так все. Сам не ожидал, что напишу красный отзыв на эту игру((

35651285.review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Hob[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]
[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]

Hob is an almost entirely gameplay focused experience. It's a 3D action adventure platformer with combat that blends Zelda and Dark Souls. While most of your time is focused on platforming, the occasional combat segments are fun and intense. Platforming is simple but fun. I'd recommend playing with a controller as k/m make things a bit more difficult.
A lot of your time is spent roaming around trying to figure out where to go next. Sometimes the map includes a marker but even when it's there it can be hard to get to. You'll spend a decent amount of time in dungeons trying to restore order back to the world. These dungeons have small puzzles to solve and secrets to uncover. Hob has a static camera at all times, which leads to some truly gorgeous views but also some issues during combat. I'd say the views are worth it, however.

[h1]Score:[/h1] B+[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]
[h1]Story:[/h1]

There isn't much of a story here. You're thrown into a world filled with dangerous goop and tasked to get rid of it.
Runic takes pride in the lack of dialogue in this game, and i'll give them props for attempting that. It mostly works, though I think the game would benefit from a bit more clarity here and there. As you play, you sort of put together that the world saw some sort of catastrophy and a lot of it has disappeared. By going through dungeons you restore it back to normal. Even with this in mind the game sorta feels like there's no purpose to what you're doing. I'm just kinda doing things and the world reacts to them. Maybe in a sequel we'll get more of a story.

[h1]Score:[/h1] C[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]
[h1]Graphics:[/h1]

Oh lord does this game look gorgeous. It's one of the best uses of cel-shading I have ever seen. If you're not playing this on high graphics you are really missing out. The color pallette could use some variation. I get that green and purple stand for good and evil here, but there's a bit too much green. It makes it hard to tell where I've been and where I need to go next. The vistas are incredible, however. I've taken a screenshot at every single one and I really want to seek the rest out. Even when it was confusing where to go, the aesthetics were more than enough to keep me occupied.

[h1]Score:[/h1] A+[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]
[h1]Sound:[/h1]

Since there is no dialogue, there's no voice acting to critique. Combat has satisfying sword clashes and fist mashes. The score is hardly prevelant, but when it plays it's easy on the ears. Most of the tracks are quite uplifting, but there's a dark song here and there. I enjoyed it enough that I downloaded the soundtrack and placed it in an ambient work playlist for later. Not much else to say on it.

[h1]Score:[/h1] B[/td]
    [/tr]
     [tr]
        [td]
[h1]Value:[/h1]

As you may have seen from other reviews, this game is not for everyone. I enjoyed it despite it's flaws, but not everyone will. If you liked the first Jak and Daxter, you'll LOVE this game. If you don't have patience and would rather blow your way through a linear experience, maybe sit this one out. Depending on how quickly you grasp the game's concepts, your playtime will vary greatly. I have around 12 hours in but an hour and a half of that is idle time. I still have to go back for extra collectibles but I got most of them in my first play. Achievement hunters will want to go back and clear everything out, but otherwise there's really no incentive. For $20 I think the game is definitely worth it. Especially if you're into eye-candy like this.

[h1]Score:[/h1] B+[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

[i]Note: I did experience a couple crashes during my play. One every couple of hours. Saves are frequent enough to where this wasn't a huge deal, but it's fairly annoying. Keep that in mind while playing.[/i]

Hope my review helped. If you enjoyed it, be sure to check out my [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/30893425-Maxemole/?appid=435150] curator page [/url] for all sorts of indie games.

This Zelda-esque adventure puzzler sends you on a quest with minimal signposting and a grand scale unlike anything you've ever seen. As you solve problems, the world literally comes together. The action is as layered as the environment, and save points are frequent in addition to serving double duty as respawn points. There are moments of genuine connection with the creatures in Hob's world, but mind the following caveats:

The soundtrack is luscious, but isn't timed effectively to the scenes or action, and is sometimes drowned out by the luscious sound design. Hob's animations are fluid, but flawed collision detection can turn platforming and combat into a guessing game, and can cause unnecesssary deaths. The overall feel is casual and laid back with a heavy emphasis on exploration.

Also, some of the upgrades are pointless. In spite of its flaws, this is a worthwhile buy.

35627374.review:
I'm kind of torn about this game, regarding my recommendation. On one hand this game has a beautiful scenery and fun gameplay but on the other hand it was hella buggy for me, to the point it made me mad. I played the entire game with the controller.

CONTAINS MAJOR SPOILERS.

A few examples for bugs I encountered:

1. In the first 30 Minutes of the game, after you leave the starting area and the two doors get opened by the robot dude, you're able to go back into that area without going back through the doors. This causes the game to keep the doors closed and without the fist you're not able to make the ladder appear to leave the area. 
This got me stuck for like 20 minutes because I just couldn't figure out how to open those doors, of course it was a bug because those doors should have been open the entire time, you just need to to the right and trigger the opening scene before heading down or else you're basically screwed and have to begin a new game.

2. Enemies suddenly went invisible after they killed me, this was especially annoying with the big guys who have a wide area attack, at one point I couldn't pass an area because I kept getting killed by the invisible enemy. The only solution to that was restarting the game entirely. This happened quite a few times actually and it was gamebreaking.

3. Enemies disappeared in walls, this made it impossible to trigger scenes, like situations where you have to defeat all the enemies in order to make a ladder appear or anything alike. The only solution to that was getting into a teleporter and then teleporting back to the area again, sometimes I had to restart the game too. Pretty time consuming.

4. When starting the game with the launcher, the game got stuck at the first logo sometimes, to the point I had to go back to the login screen to avoid having to restart my PC because it was totally frozen. I avoided this by starting the game without a launcher.

5. Killing certain enemies in some way, I don't know how, causes their death sounds to be played in a loop, for example the guy that throws the exploding blue thingies at you. It was kind of funny though so I wouldn't really want that one to be patched out, it also fades away once you're gone from the area where the enemy is in.

The jumping in this game is incredibly annoying, mostly because I personally dislike the idea of linear jumping, from the beginning it didn't feel "right" to me. I'd have preffered to have air control in a game like this and I still think it would have been better after finishing it. Sometimes it just didn't really register your direction input right and you ended up jumping somewhere you didn't want to jump, especially into an abyss or on the top of thorns and once you're on the top of thorns, you're screwed because you can't jump for some reason and you'll die.

The enemies are a bit too easy in my opinion, I played the game on very hard and once you got all the patterns down they're really not that hard to beat, it's just a 1 2 3 pattern each time and easy to avoid by rolling. The only difficulty comes up when the game just spams enemies at you but that doesn't really have to do with difficulty but more with mashing your button and teleporting around the area. 

Blocking is so goddamn useless in this game, I maybe used the shield like 3 times and it was really unreliable each time, so I always preferred rolling or teleporting over blocking. The upgrade that gives you energy orbs with blocking is pretty nice but that also brought up the question why energy orbs weren't just a normal part of the game? They were pretty useful but I only got to use it in the last fight, where it pretty much saved me.

The story is really confusing to me unfortunately, to be honest I still have no idea what is going on there or what happened, who the roboter guy is, who the burning lady at the end is, who that silent girl is that you can kill at the end.
What happened when you chose to reach out for the hand of the burning lady? I mean the  game just ended and I got an achievement saying something but I was only baffled and was like "what the fu*k?". Those lore rooms didn't help me either, it were just some shapes that moved on a wall so I started ignoring those rooms entirely and stopped looking for "swordkey" parts.

Then there are these "vantage points" where you can sit down or lean on a wall and look at the scenery I guess? I just thought they were kind of unnecessary because I was admiring the whole landscape the entire time anyway, I love floating islands and stuff like that so the game got to me anyway.

Ok, of course the game also has positive aspects, as I already said the scenery is beautiful and I love the whole art style of the game, which is heavily based on shapes.
The music was really nice too, harmonized well with the surroundings and everything.
But yeah I couldn't get the bad taste out my mouth from all the stuff I mentioned before.

Still I would recommend this game because after they released some patches it already started to run better and I got it quite early after release.

35621323.review:
Runic Games, creators of the Torchlight series, are back on the market with Hob, a puzzle/combat-light game with a few RPG elements thrown in. The beautiful visuals and stunning soundtrack don’t make up for some clunky gameplay and a story that may fail to engage players. A team brave enough to change completely genre moving away from a golden goose like Torchlight in order to create a little gem of level design and exploration. A puzzle game full of mysteries and wonder. Runic Games take you on a wondrous mysterious journey through fantastic environments making Hob well worth your time. 

In terms of gameplay, Hob feels like a close cousin to [b]The Legend of Zelda[/b]. A pretty good action-adventure, with a fantastic world eager to be explored with satisfying puzzles and fun. The creature design in this game is so fantastic. The combat system is a little bit too simple, but the experience is really positive. Hob never loses momentum as you dive deeper and deeper into the game. It constantly rewards you by making the game easy to consume and feeling like you can go for just a little longer.  As a result, this is one of the few games that I’ve ever had trouble putting down. The gorgeous artwork might draw you in but the content will not let you leave. All in all It's a really great if at times a little frustrating puzzle/platformer full of Henson-like characters and moodiness reminiscent of films like The Dark Crystal or animated films like Don Bluth's Secret of Nimh. If you have ever played an action/adventure game and felt like exploring the map was a waste of time after a few hours, welcome to the explorers dream.

35596627.review:
Hob es un título extraño. Muy de a poco nos invita a su particular mundo de exploración, puzzles y algo de RPG de acción. El juego de Runic Games requiere paciencia y consistencia para disfrutarlo a pleno.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bYAR651McII
Análisis completo publicado [url=https://www.simpatiaporlacritica.com/single-post/2017/10/09/Hob]aquí[/url]

Desde el lanzamiento de Torchlight, sobre todo desde la segunda entrega, existe un idilio entre la desarrolladora Runic Games y el gran público gamer. Esta gran aceptación logró que haya mucha expectativa por el próximo juego de Runic, que no iba a continuar con la saga Torchlight. El resultado es Hob, cuyo desarrollo tomó años de esfuerzo y sacrificio, como suele suceder en todos los estudios independientes. Las conclusiones son difíciles de clasificar, ya que si bien la aceptación es favorable, hay varias reservas que nos gustaría compartir con todos ustedes.
 
Generalmente empezamos las reseñas contando un poco de la historia o la trama del juego. En el caso de Hob, esta tarea se nos dificulta ya que apenas tenemos indicios sobre lo que está ocurriendo en el mundo del juego. De hecho, no hay tutoriales, guías de control, sugerencias, diálogos, absolutamente nada. Los personajes se expresan con sonidos y gestos, haciendo que tengamos que adivinar qué hay que hacer en cada paso que damos. La ausencia de una interfaz que nos lleve de la mano en todo momento no es algo necesariamente malo (quizás los más jóvenes lo sientan mas) pero que usualmente funciona en juegos minimalistas. Hob tiene pretensiones épicas, desde su motor gráfico, la amplitud de escenarios, variedad de movimientos, mecánicas intrincadas, etc. Es irónico que un juego con tantas aspiraciones tenga un contenido narrativo tan pobre, como si no importara. Estamos de acuerdo que muy de poco vamos entendiendo la historia, pero la sutileza no siempre funciona en todo el público, y consideramos un error depender de ella en un juego de este calibre.

También es difícil encasillar a Hob en un género definido. Podemos decir que es un juego de exploración y puzzles de escenario, también se puede llamar un ARPG, o incluso un juego de plataformas. Cada definición por separado sería correcta, al igual que todas juntas. A esto apuntamos cuando decimos que éste es un juego de por de más ambicioso. Hob pareciera no conformarse con nada, explotar absolutamente todas las ideas que surgieron en el desarrollo, lo cual no siempre es algo bueno. 
 
Hay que reconocer, sin embargo, que las mecánicas funcionan bien, siempre y cuando logremos entenderlas. Hay un trabajo muy pulido en los movimientos del personaje que son muy ricos en variedad y combinaciones. Más allá de los controles simples (saltar, correr, esquivar, atacar) hay una especie de árbol de habilidades con skills únicos que iremos comprando o combinando para ir progresando en nuestro daño y resistencia. Por otro lado, todas estas habilidades serán completamente indistintas en el aspecto de exploración del juego, donde nos pasaremos investigando los escenarios para combinar objetos, descubrir pasajes o poner en funcionamiento extraños mecanismos que nos harán progresar en la historia.
 
Esta dualidad de acción y puzzles producen una incomodidad en el gameplay que no logramos sacudir. La complejidad del juego hace que nunca podamos relajarnos y disfrutarlo. Esta tensión de nunca saber totalmente cuál es el siguiente paso, eliminar enemigos en el medio y resolver algunos puzzles también, producen que no podamos definir a Hob como un juego "divertido". Sin embargo, sin duda podemos decir que es un juego interesante.
 
En resumen, recomendamos este juego con algunas reservas, advirtiendo claramente que es un título pensado para un tipo de público y la gran masa de jugadores probablemente no lo entenderá. La calidez de la comunidad con Runic Games salvó a este juego de la indiferencia o incluso de la mala prensa. Sin embargo, Runic debería tomar nota ya que raramente la industria (y sobre todo los jugadores) dan segundas oportunidades ante un paso en falso. La espalda y las buenas reseñas de Torchlight salvaron a Hob del fracaso.

35586844.review:
Looking through the credits, it struck me as weird that this game didn't have any dedicated game designers. It makes me wonder how much of an impact that had on its creation.

Hob is an interesting experiment that has potential. It has an interesting art style and some interesting design ideas that ultimately fail to mesh together. 

The Good:
Combat and exploration. 

Combat is used sparingly but feels decently rewarding. You react to enemies hitting you, evade and go in for some hits. You don't have to manage stamina or energy and some enemies require you to remove their armor in various ways, but beyond that it's fairly straightforward. I kind of wish that the dodge roll and attacks would require stamina, so that there would be more decision making in the heat of battle. Enemies stay dead forever once slain, so there is not really any incentive to get good at combat either, which is a shame. Sometimes combat is combined with platforming elements, at which point the game becomes very VERY frustrating.

Exploration keeps the game going once you are about 2 hours in, because that's about when the game starts giving the player long term goals and the story actually unfolds. Until then players are gated off from most of the interesting content, while the game has to fulfill a long winded first arc of the game. However, once you are free to explore, the game really takes off, and finding upgrades through opening up the environment or revealing new areas was for me the height of the experience.

The Bad:

The concept of no dialogue was a great idea, but it felt poorly executed through the game. Especially during the first two hours you are led by an NPC through the world, not really knowing what to do or indeed why you are doing what you are doing. There is some corruption in the land, but it takes a long while before the game lets you do something about it. Usually no dialogue in games also means that the game will try and communicate with the player in different ways to understand certain new mechanics, especially so in a tutorial. Unfortunately, that is not the case with Hob. I found myself stuck early on because I needed to use a mechanic that the game hadn't even let me know existed in the game before.

Puzzles fall in the same category, and become hard to solve not because they are difficult, but because the game fails to inform the player about all the possible decisions/choices.

Controls and camera, and platforming. Easily the worst part of the game are both the controls and camera. The controls change relative to the way the character is facing, not which way the camera is facing, making it really difficult to control the character. The camera itself is fixed to certain locations based on the player's location. The angles chosen for the camera make the game really difficult to maneuver even if doing simple actions such as walking.

This is exacerbated through the type of level design the game uses, and is especially a huge problem during platforming. I died countless times on the simplest platforming jumps simply because my character would not jump in what otherwise seemed like the right direction. Ladders that were to the sides of the camera were very difficult to climb up, and this was made worse when the camera was obstructed by world geometry.

Based on these things it is hard for me to recommend the game. It's sad when a game that has some really interesting concepts going on, both visually and gameplay wise, is brought down by the lack of fundamental game design (and in the case of Hob's team, actual game designers).

35572797.review:
Hob é um jogo de plataforma 3D com muitos puzzles com uma pitada de RPG, que com certeza vai te fazer raciocionar muito! Pra quem gosta de games do gênero, esse aqui com certeza é um "must-have" na lista. Quando você começa a jogar, duvido que consiga jogar apenas 10 minutos, 30 minutos. Você sempre quer descobrir mais, desvendar mais mistérios, ver mais desse belíssimo mundo que a Runic Games construiu.

O jogo não possui diálogo nenhum, não tem tutorial nenhum, nada. Você vai descobrindo o jogo conforme joga, e também descobre as habilidades (recomendo utilizar um controle para jogar) com o passar do tempo. Inclusive os combos. Mas isso não torna o jogo um desmerecimento, depois de um tempo jogando, você vai simplesmente achar essa ideia da Runic Games fantástica! Porque o jogo é realmente viciante!

O mapa do jogo é sandbox, e é praticamente um LEGO, onde conforme você vai resolvendo os quebra-cabeças, você fica vislumbrado com a arte do jogo, e vê outras partes do mapa sendo montadas bem na frente de seus olhos, e tudo isso se torna mágico.

Hob, torno a repetir, é um jogo que você, apreciador de jogos do gênero, PRECISA ter na sua lista! Garanto que não irá se arrepender!

Nota: [spoiler]10/10 (bem que poderia ter mais história!).[/spoiler]

I was pleasently suprised by this game. First off, I really love the art style. It is very much similar to other Runic Games. Normally, I will not play a game that requires a controller. The biggest thing that I like about the game is that you can relax while playing it, Sure, it is a platformer, but it tends to lean more twoard the puzzle side. I also enjoy that fact that the game doesn't hold your hand. It lets you exploe to figure out where to go next instead of telling you.

I highly reccomend this game for anyone who enjoys platformers and puzzle games.

35533199.review:
2018/1/8 更新並整理評論

整體來說，RUNIC GAMES是一群前暴雪員工所組成的公司無誤，在音樂與美術風格上的表現都十分出色，甚至某些橋段的音樂你可以找的到暗黑2的影子，但必須得說在程式方面就寫得很爛，依靠大量的更新檔來把旗下遊戲改成勉強可玩，這款也毫不例外。

[h1]簡單地替我投下負評的原因做個總結，視角設計真的非常模糊，很多地下世界跳浮游板的視角都做得很差勁，讓玩家搞不清該跳的方向，然後很多機關喜歡以視角來作為觸發機關與否的條件，這一點在你拿到抓取能力後會非常有感。[/h1]

我曾經放棄過這個遊戲一次，上一次更新評論就是因為當時更新造成的BUG讓我被迫放棄全成就而灰心之時所寫，而回頭決定從頭再拚一趟 少於5死+不升級+5小時內過關 這個成就組合，是我過幾天後給迷城之光(HoB)的最終審判。

儘管最後我還是達成了全成就，但最終旅途我還是沒有留下好印象，某些錯誤的設計足以完全摧毀音樂與美術風格方面帶來的加分。


[h1]結論[/h1]

[h1]無特定目標的輕度玩家[/h1]
推薦，即使是以原價入手，迷城之光的音樂與美術風格依然非常對得起他的定價，以上兩者所勾勒出的世界非常地引人入勝，撇開戰鬥的部分來說，就連開著四處晃晃都可以是一種享受。

同時這也是RUNIC GAMES的遺作，該工作室已被解散。錯過這一次，或許很難再見到這樣特別的作品了。

[h1]什麼都想玩過一遍、追求破關的玩家[/h1]
同上，這是少數我認為輕度與中度玩家都會很滿意的作品。

[h1]追求全成就、100%完成度的重度玩家[/h1]
完全就是要看你有多少耐心(或者是你有多M)來決定，雖然5死、5小時破關、不升級各自要達成都不是太難，但是跟我一樣通通在一趟裡完成絕對是一場M度鑑定賽，尤其是遊戲中有兩三個殺手級的跳躍地點是不可避的。


[h1]最後，在此向所有跟我一樣，面對並跨過那些刁鑽的挑戰、達成全成就的玩家致上小小的敬意。[/h1]

First I was sceptical, since its  so different from what Runic made before. But I gave it a shot, since I really liked the Art Style shown in preview videos and reviews. I even watched half an episode of a Lets Play, before I decided to buy it. 

But damn was I rewarded!

This is slowly rumored as the Zelda for PC and now 8h in I really can see why. It hooks slowly but once you begin to discover more and more from the world you really start to enjoy it. 

And even if there is a lot of cuteness to this game they keep it challenging, in regards to combat and riddles.

Стим показывал игру в рекомендуемых, но я ее игнорировала, потому что трейлер и скрины совсем не впечатлили. В нее надо поиграть час, и ты в нее влюбишься. От нее невозможно оторваться. Тебе хочется еще и еще. Я прошла всю игру, и мне интересно просто бегать по этому миру и собирать все ачивки. Хочется получить амнезию, и пройти эту игру снова.
Графика: Она приятная, в зависимости от локации имеет свой оттенок, текстуры качественно прорисованы, красивые дальние фоны, милые животные и мобы необычные.
Звуковое сопровождение: Саунд подобран очень хорошо, музыка на фоне, озвучка персонажей, животных, мобов - все отлично. И делает игру еще лучше.
Также в игре присутствуют интересные загадки, механики, сражения с мобами и местами смена камеры или видов, что разнообразил геймплей. Пару раз игра умудрилась меня напугать. Рыба, я тебя запомнила!

在一个特大号的地图上到处跑，得到越多的道具（比方钩爪之类的）就能找到更多的路，探索更多的地图，类似塞尔达传说，如果对影藏要素很感兴趣，那么这游戏会很适合你。难度还算简单，玩起来挺轻松，除了以下的缺点以外全是优点。
那么说一下缺点，首先基本没剧情，不知道主角在忙什么；再来开拓新路的方法有时候有些无厘头，没什么逻辑，比方杀害路边的小兵等等（其实那些应该算是boss，只是长的和小兵没两样）；最重要的一点，也是这类游戏共通的毛病，那就是总会碰到找不到路的时候（尤其刚开始还不大熟悉这游戏机关的设计习惯），地图又特大，在几个地方绕来绕去相当杀时间，还不时的会不小心刷死或是被小兵揍死从而回到上一个记录点从新来过（不过这游戏的记录点还算多，而且死了以后，刚才的积累，吃的东西，启动的机关等等，都会保留）。

35513926.review:
[h1]Spoiler free review, with a short and longer version, with a bonus rant:[/h1]

[b]TLDR version[/b]

buy Hob if:

+ you love Zelda-alike games
+ you enjoy simple linear platforming, puzzling and combat
+ you prefer being amused by simple game mechanics rather than by its story
+ you're looking for a linear gaming experience

don't buy Hob if:

- [u]you can't stand repetitivity[/u]
- you don't like simple puzzles based entirely on button pressing and exploration
- [u]you like enemy diversity and boss fights[/u] (both absent here)
- you enjoy digging into lore elements and history

[b]Verdict: 6.5/10, good looking but really mediocre game[/b]
Time required to 100% the main game without a guide: 13-14 hours
Time required to speedrun it: 4-5 hours
Time required to get all the achievements: 30 hours (maybe)

[b]Detailed version[/b]

1- [b]The game's strongest point is its aesthetic[/b], which you will be always be able to appreciate thanks to the multiple "vistas points" scattered all around the game map (which is quite vast) and through its dungeons, just to show:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1159559567

2- [b]The combat, upgrade system and the enemy variety are predictable and unoriginal[/b], meaning that those hidden schematics you will find will contain predictable (sorry for the repetition....uh. The irony.) and not so "useful-and-game changing-addition"; that the enemy variety is absent and that their combat moves and patterns are easily spotted and understandable at a first glance

3- [b]The game is as repetitive as a old man that does nothing all day and that didn't do anything funny or worthwile in his life besides listening to village/ harbor rumors and gossips[/b]
You will often have to walk in circles (literally, you will even do it at different heights) to press different buttons that will change the world's appearance and the game's stages in order to allow you to get upgrades and hidden/distant game locations. Even if seeing gears and huge cogs moving and grinding can be quite compelling, seeing it for hours might get you bored or less interested in the gameplay.

REAL LIFE "RANT-ISH" EXAMPLE:
[u][b]The more i played this game the more i had that same feeling that i had while wooing a girl i liked (unsuccessfully): i kinda (pfff) knew she wouldn't say yes eventually, but i was like: "well, i've started already, let's see how it pans out". Ofc i ended up with nothing in my hands (Postitive Mental Attitude at its finest) and lot of wasted time and efforts but i was committed to finish what i started (which...i'm not sure what i even had started and accomplished).[/b][/u]

Shitty and cheesy jokes aside, the more you'll play, the more you'll realize that there's nothing to play for:
a)[u] boss fights are absent.[/u] Period. Even if there's a "corrupted world" theme and gigantic dungeons, forget the idea that you'll be facing grotesque or forgotten creatures. The only fearsome creature you'll face today will be this long winded review
b) [u]lore elements are extremely rare and not properly explained[/u]. Even accessing to "lore areas" and dungeons will not reveal that much to you.
c) [u]the map is not consistent[/u], meaning that it will show you those collectibles you've missed picking once you'll get enough close to them, but it won't allow you to "blacken/cross" them when you've collected them, making the collectibles' hunt less enjoyable. On top of that, dungeons' entrances aren't pointed out on the map and there's no map for underground dungeons
d) even getting all the butteflies, sword pieces etc WILL NOT GIVE YOU ANYTHING WORTHWILE (hence my cheesy rant example). If you want to be really rewarded for your collectible hunting efforts, then play Hollow Knight or Hyper Light Drifter (both reviewed by me, feel free to check and rate my reviews).[b] Getting upgrades won't improve your game experience, it will only allow you to kill enemies more easliy[/b]

TO SUM UP:
Buy this game if you want an average and pleasant platforming gaming experience, if you're looking for a platforming and adventure masterpiece, LOOK SOMEWHERE ELSE, as besides Hob's good visual experience, there's not more to recommend here.

Thanks for reading and for bearing up with me, leave a comment below if you have any questions or observations, have an amazing day/night.

35513696.review:
Absolutely enjoyable. With mouse + keyboard, control seems a little bit imprecise at times, or the perspective makes control harder than necessary.
Other than that, very immersive, beautiful. The lack of text and dialogue make you discover the story, or possibilities of what the story could be, which makes the game rather unique.
The world is rather big, and changes. So there is replay value, because you simply forget how things were at the beginning, because they look completely different at the end.
I love the artstyle. Realistic graphics does not appeal to me. I can have that if I simply go outside. But stylised, alien worlds with their own aesthetic? We're talking.

Still, one really major complaint: Even if the world seems huge (after all, you run all of it on foot, if you don't "tube" point-to-point), it's way too small! I want more Hob!

视觉上绝对可以给满分，剧情演出也做的极其出色，能让玩家在一开始就获得非常好的体验。游戏中期流程自由度比较高，与其说注重“解密”不如说注重“探索”，谜题没有固定的顺序，玩家可以在大地图上自由探索，发现谜题，解决谜题。问题就是玩家比较容易陷入迷茫，不知道下一步该干什么，只能在地图上瞎转悠（任务提示，有时候会标注在大地图上，有时候不会）。游戏没有任何教程，以及任何文字上的交流，有些谜题需要连猜带蒙，有些关键的地图入口点又非常难找，玩家如果耐心稍微差一点的话估计很容易弃坑而错过一款神作。

35486152.review:
I finish the game without ever needing to buy any sort of combo skills and upgrades, only discovered health and energy cubes and sword parts. Probably took me a good 8 hours to complete figuring out how to restore the world. Every button reveals an awesome reaction and pressing buttons have never been so satisfying like ever compared to this game.

This game reminds me if Torchlight met with Soul Reaver and the Legacy of Kain series. Without dialogue, the story reveals a touching depth that can be found from developers with passion to an overall vision of a game. The skills and upgrades only befitting a core character progress that is neat and simple but can evolve in complexity during battle. The core skill upgrade reminds me when Raziel gets his core talent as a wraith, more accesible paths open up across the world, in Hob's case, His replaced arm... 'armaments'. However, the armament upgrade can also be used in battle.

Overall, this game feels short for me in 2017 on whatever price but the feeling this game gives me...that exploration, watching entire terrain shifts due to my actions, the story gradually panning out as I go, figuring out puzzles that arent so megalomanic but rewards it brilliantly, the musical score and creatures of this world, the ambient feeling. All this has been missing in today's heavy hitter AAA games. The encapsulating all encompassing single player experience that is worth the play...I miss that and this game delivers on that front 100%.

10/10 would press random buttons to gasp in awe again - Dee Dee from Dexter's Laboratory

35478823.review:
Пожалуй мой первый в жизни обзор будет именно на этой игру. Почему? Причин несколько:
1. Рисовка. Эту игру я начал ждать, когда узнал, что её делали разработчики Torchlight (каюсь не прошёл, но несколько часов удовольствия для глаз я получил).
2. Мир. О том как меняются локации после очередной пройденной головоломки, просто без комментариев.
3. История. Незамысловатая (я бы даже сказал простая до банальности), но подана интересно. Сложно было остановиться, потому что всегда интересно, что будет дальше.
4. Музыка. Довольно расслабляющая и, на мой взгляд, идельно подходит к стилю игры.
5. Противники. Тоже вписываются в мир. Хоть они и простые, но к некоторым нужен свой подход.
6. Длительность. Прошёл за пару вечеров. (для меня это +)
Если будете искать все секреты игра затянется ещё на пару вечеров. (их тут действительно много)
7. Соотношение цена- качество. Видно что сделано с душой. (многие игры за 2к меня не затянули как эта)
Есть у этой игры и недостатки. 
1. Управление. Кто бы что не говорил, умирать вы будете чаще всего именно из-за него. И не важно с клавиатуры вы играете или с джойстика. (я играл с клавы)
2. Баги. Их немного и связаны они частично с управлением. 
Несмотря на эти недостатки, прошёл игру на одном дыхании, и написал этот обзор только для того, что может кому то он поможет принять решение в покупке этой игры. Кому- то будет обидно такое пропустить.

35467445.review:
It makes sense so many are comparing this title to Zelda. There are a ton of parallels, the most important being that you can scythe down patches of grass with your sword (sometimes finding money). 

Hob features a strong emphasis on environmental puzzles but it also includes weapons and skills + upgrades etc. and enemies throughout, which gives it some needed variation. The monsters you encounter are -not- the focal point and are hardly ever a real obstacle, but to create a fantastical world like this and not have enemies in it at all would simply be a let down. 
The puzzles themselves as far as difficulty goes are challenging at times but definitely not "difficult." So far I haven't found myself getting stuck on an area for an unreasonable amount of time or ever thinking "this shit is unfair". It may be an adventure game but it's definitely one you can just relax and play casually. 

The thing I love most about Hob is the art style. Each new area is breathtaking in it's own way, not to mention the world as a cohesive whole, which grows/opens up to you in surprising ways as you progress forward. 
Stylistically in a nut shell I'd say it's somehow both mechanical and magical at the same time. It's definitely unique.

35464137.review:
如果说火炬之光尚且是在向暗黑破坏神系列“致敬”的话，那么这款Hob则是完全的创新之作。我想做游戏的人都有这样的梦想吧，在积累了足够的力量以后，要做出真正的杰作，我觉得他们真的实现了，我真希望自己也能像他们一样。
可能是我玩的游戏不多，但这款游戏的机关设计之宏伟、精巧是我从没见过的，整个游戏里的世界都像是一个巨大的机关，又与自然风貌融为一体。随着关卡推进地形不断升降，旋转，令人叹为观止。
游戏的节奏体验也非常好，常常是在经历一段艰难的探索以后到达目的地，然后就能开通一条直达起点的捷径，可以说魂系列的捷径设计理念在这里是遍地开花，而且形式更加立体。众所周知魂系列的地图设计是一绝，但这款游戏的地图设计我感觉已经超越了魂世界，到达了一个更新的高度，真正的是站在巨人肩膀上又往前走了两步。
说到这个，游戏的结局还真是站在了巨人肩膀上再往上走两步哈哈哈哈。
总之这是一款凝结了天才构思与成熟技术的神作，强烈推荐！

35458687.review:
Ein sehr schönes, gut balanciertes und faires Spiel. 
Am Interaktionsdesign hat mir das Fehlen von Schrift gefallen. Abseits vom Hauptmenü wird mit dem Spieler nur über Symbole und Gesten kommuniziert. 
Das Spiel ist nicht zu hektisch. Es wird eher Wert auf Geschicklichkeit als Geschwindigkeit gelegt. 

Die Grafik ist reduziert, aber wunderschön und sTimmungsvoll. Dabei macht es einen riesigen Spaß an den Hebeln zu ziehen, die Knöpfe zu drücken und Räder zu drehen. Die Spielelemente nutzen sich dabei nicht ab, sondern haben fast jedes Mal irgendwas Neues dabei. 

Die Map könnte etwas hübscher sein und das Reisesystem etwas besser erklärt werden (wobei man die Punkte nur mit den Richtungstasten anwählt und Enter drückt). 

Ich habe das Spiel in etwa 16 Stunden durchgespielt und finde den Preis von 20,- angemessen. 

Mein persönliches Highlight, war dass man mit den Feen kuscheln kann. 
Spoiler: Es gibt zwei Enden. Eines davon ist ein Bosskampf.

35456138.review:
I've spent a few hours with Hob, and though I haven't finished it yet I can say that this is definitely one of my favorite games I've ever played. Without a single word said, it tells the story of a broken world ravaged by war against the disease spreading across its surface. Lost in this world you move forward, never quite knowing what's going on beyond the path in front of you until finally it starts coming together. Literally. The world is made whole again by your hand as your actions add up to restore everything you've fought through.

I've never played a game where you changed so much of the landscape not just as a result of playing it, but as an actual game mechanic to solve various puzzles and challenges. The art style is amazing, the gameplay solid. My only complaint lies in some framerate drops during loading of new areas which can be especially annoying during combat. Beyond that continuing issue despite a couple optimization patches, there's nothing else that bothers me about this game at all. That's a rare thing to be able to say.

35451236.review:
From the simple blades of grass and the way they move around Hob to the ancient ruins with their now dormant collosal gaurdians, the world of Hob combines hulking machinary with flora and fauna to create a beautiful and magical world. 

The main path and its goals are laid out with clever design cues incorporated into an art style that I wasn't sure about at first but which by the end of the game I now adore, if you're lost or stuck you're simply not paying attention, many of the worlds secrets are locked away and require careful observation and exploration. Mention has to be made of the way some of the contraptions and the world itself move and come together, there was clearly a lot of thought and love put into this game by the developers.

While it's not without it's flaws (in the 15 hours I've spent so far I've experienced one invisible enemy and one crash to desktop) this is a must buy if you even remotely enjoy any sort of platformer/exploration type game.

Love this game. The game world is both pleasing and fantastic to look at, they have really put some effort into making it pretty. I also love the fact that you don't get page of text to read or irretating cut scenes during gameplay to tell you what the story is. 

The combat although does seem a little too easy in places, but harder in others, is great and something I love the game for. The puzzle aspect of the game is great too .... many times I've been running round like a headless chicken trying to find out where to go or what I need to do when it's been in front of me the whole time.

When I first got the game I was irretated by the fact you don't have a rotating camera view so that when you got behind something you could rotate the camera, but now I have played it for a while, it no longer bothers me that much. 

For anyone who wants to watch a gameplay video before purchase, I'd recommend watching the gameplay series on Youtube by Wanderbots.

Despite the issues with the nVidia cards, I would still recommend this game to everyone, I am sure Runic will resolve the issue sooner rather than later.

35441424.review:
This is a gorgeous game, that I enjoyed alot, although I'm generally not a big fan of platformers. If you consider yourself a hardcore gamer, this game is definitely not for you, you'll feel it's too easy. 

I enjoyed the exploration aspect of the game, most of it is logical and makes sense. I do not enjoy a lot of games because things there seem arbitrary and you do not know why something work and why something else does not. Not many games include a manual describing game mechanics, and often it's not possible to figure those out by just playing the game. Well, with Hob, mechanics are well thought out so that they are obvious to you very soon.

The minuses are in my opinion minor: Combat while is not difficult, can be tedious. Frame rate severely drops on some scenes. The camera angles in certain (rare) locations glitch and it's possible to get stuck inside geometry, so you have to respawn to progress. And in certain location angles you have to move/jump at are not obvious at all, so it takes quite a few failures to progress past the problematic location.

35440237.review:
Ich kann Hob wirklich jeden Empfehlen. 
Es befriedigt unheimlich den Erkundungsdrang und lässt einem nicht eher aufhören bis man JEDE Ecke der Spielwelt erforscht hat. Die Spielwelt selbst ist schon wahnsinnig spannend, in den tieften Höhen bis auf die höchsten Säulen und Berge, wird einem viel geboten. Ganze Areale lassen sich durch Rätsel freischalten und /oder ändern sich dramatisch, sodass in bekannten Gebieten sich das ein oder andere erreichen lässt. 
Es kann zusätzlich auch noch neue Kampffähigkeit oder Upgrades der Waffe oder der Ausrüstung gesammelt werden, was auch sehr sinnvoll ist. Mit dem freigehaltenen grünen Umhang durch die Spielwelt zu flitzen macht schon Spaß. 
Und mit jedem Schwertupgrade auch ein neues Archiv in der Spielwelt öffnen zu können, belohnt das Erkunden unheimlich. Auch wenn Die Archive selbst sehr kryptisch sind. 

Das Kampfsystem finde ich gut. Ich würde mir aber eine Eigen Belegung der Tasten wünschen statt einfach nur aus 3 Schemata zu wählen. 

Hob hat aber auch noch einige Probleme, die aber nicht Spielentscheidend sind. 
Ich gehe mal davon aus das die noch gepatcht werden.
Das häufigste was auftritt sind das Items oder das Leben nicht ganz Angezeigt wird, mal ein Gegner unsichtbar ist oder das Gras verschwindet. Aber alles nicht so schwerwiegend. 

Was aber einem Schwierigkeiten macht ist die Steuerung!! Mit der Tastatur sind mache Sprungpassagen mehr Glück als Können. Das Spiel ist auf die Konsole ausgelegt und manche diagonalen Sprungeinlagen schwierig, aber nicht unmöglich, 
dazu zählt auch der Einsatz der Kopplung an zwei Stellen. 

Die Musik, ist eher vernachlässigbar, passt aber ganz gut der Welt, muss man sich aber nicht unbedingt mit kaufen.

Trotz der Macken, hat es viel Spaß gemacht!!!
Großes Lob wegen der sich veränderbaren Spielwelt, Schwerpunkt Level Design. A1
Manche Dinge sind sehr geschickt versteckt.

Ich würde mich über einen zweiten Teil freuen.

35439754.review: Игра очень понравилась. Первая реакция - это же Зельда, та самая, которая вышла давным-давно на Nintendo. Лично я увидел много схожего, интересно изучать, головоломки простые и это скорее плюс, так-как локации многоуровневые. Бегать приходиться много, даже учитывая возможность быстро перемещаться. Подача сюжета схожа с серией Souls, минимум подсказок о том, что произошло и кто виноват. Почти всё додумываешь и придумываешь сам, это и плохо и хорошо.  Хорошо - развиваешь фантазию, если она есть. Плохо - нужно очень чётко дозировать игроку подобную механику подачи, ибо он может разочароваться в финале. Подводя итог: игра отличная, интересная, красивая, освоить просто. Оптимизация пока не высшем уровне, есть места где просадка ФПС заметна на отличном железе. Управление почти идеальное. Ну и самое плохое в конце, финал. Как я писал ранее, лично для меня он оказался смазанным именно из-за малого кол-вообще информации о мире. Но это не смертельно :) Выбрал «плохой» финал, он живее и тронул. Хороший финал смотрел на YouTube и понял, что сделал верный выбор. Рекомендую играть.

35438330.review:
先说下，你们体会过打了好几百个字的评论，然后评论提示出现未知错误，然后在全选之后ctrl+c没法复制，刷新之后ctrl+v的绝望吗？G胖CMN。
游戏总体可以，画风很不错，解密很有趣，场景切换的感觉也很骚，以及有几个场景的前后关联解密，也是很棒的。
缺点也很明显，操作优化真垃圾，左摇杆的体验，用一句话说就是迷，上梯子是一个，固定上推是上梯子，下推是下梯子，但是你被梯子吸住的方向又是可以各个方向上去的，给人的体验就是不流畅，必须先被梯子吸住，然后在上推左摇杆上去，就不能做个优化，从那个方向被梯子吸住，就继续往哪个方向推摇杆上梯子难道不好吗。还是摇杆，自动视角下，这个摇杆很容易偏啊，有时候好几次摔死都是因为这个，再一个就是前后物体的层叠关系真不明显，导致很容易错位掉下去。
剧情方面么，也是一句话，活在梦里，没有文字也没有语音，就知道是世界被紫色物体侵袭，主角拯救世界（或者和平共处）的这个套路。

35433118.review:
Primeiramente: NÃO leve nenhuma análise em consideração com menos de 8 horas de jogo.
NÃO existe nenhuma pessoa que consiga fazer uma análise decente com menos de 8 horas de jogo.
- O ponto principal do jogo é a transformação do mapa. É nítido e maravilhoso ver tudo em sua volta mudar e trazer novos caminhos que antes não eram possíveis.
- Ótima direção de arte.
- Gráficos bons.
- Dificuldade no ponto certo. Não é aquele jogo fácil mas também não é difícil.
- Jogabilidade boa maaaasss...
- Controles não são precisos. Se prepare para errar bastante pulos (se jogar no controle)
- Mundo aberto... sim, esse jogo é mundo aberto e se acostume em passar várias vezes pelo mesmo local.
- Boa história. Não há nenhuma reviravolta então não espere se surpreender.
- Existem dois finais. COMPLETE os dois sem pensar duas vezes.
- Música boa mas com problemas em certos pontos dos mapas... você dá dois passos pra direita e a música começa, anda dois passos pra esquerda, ela para e fica assim pra sempre, vamos ver se eles vão corrigir em alguma atualização.
- Certos sons não são reguláveis nas opções. Por mais que você coloque o som no baixo, algumas vezes a música ficará bastante alta. Exemplo: sempre ao pegar pó para habilidades, uma música altíssima toca e você não consegue diminuir a não ser se tirar completamente o som do jogo.
- Se você quer um jogo com puzzles difíceis, acho que esse jogo não é pra você pois a maioria deles são fáceis e se repetem várias vezes com o passar do jogo. Hob é mais focado em exploração do que puzzles.
- Fator "REPLAY" praticamente NULO pois o jogo é absurdamente linear. Só começa um novo save quem realmente é fã do jogo ou quem quer pegar conquista.

Recomendo? Recomendo. Não era aquilo que esperava... posso ter criado muito hype no jogo pois estou na espera desde agosto de 2016 mas acho que é um bom jogo. Se for comprado em promoção, melhor ainda.

35432099.review: A word you will never hear when discribing Runic Games is "Innovation". This is basically Zelda. Yes, Runic rips off others ideas pretty well. I enjoyed Torchlight I & II. I think I will even enjoy this game if they can fix the problems with it that make it difficult to play. I don't mean difficult in the sense that it's hard. Some parts will have you scrching your head for a bit but it's not too challenging combat or puzzle wise. It's difficult becuse apparently they got some homeless guy in front of a gas station to test it. You'll find youself in the middle of combat and you'll be stuck behind a wall and you cannot see what's going on. You'll see icons scattered around the map but with no direction as to what they mean (mostly). When a dev makes a game that chooses to go with little to no voice or written directions, you could say that they are lazy. I do. I'm sure they would say they are being "artistic". None of this really matters because as of this writing they have not fixed the problems with people who are using Nvidia 10 series cards. Therefore, you will see massive framerate drops as the game goes on. One of the most popular cards on the market and you release a game not tested with it? Stay away fror now.

35431816.review:
what a fun game! pretty artwork, complex interactions of enviroment and a fun story with a cute avatar.!
puzzles are really nice and the whole changing world approach makes for good platforming without the usual impossible fences or odd method of blocking your progress.
fighting is good, several basic attacks and supers give a good mix of styles against a number of enemy types which do give a challenge.
Overall I find this game without flaw.
I suspect my only complaint will be I want to play more.
I found torchlight2( same developers) a fun complex rpg game despite my dislike of the mouse clicking. The same level of thought (or more) gives HOB a deep complex gameplay missing in so many new games and it is a clear extension of the great work by the Devs at Runic.
I think this team should be considered one of the best in the business and I hope they keep up the good work! 
Get this game!!!!!!!!
10/10....!!!!!!!!!

35431558.review: This is easily the most intriguing game I have played in a long while, the puzzles are challenging without being frustrating (most of the time), and the game play is fun and exciting. I would buy this game five times over just to hear the soundtrack merging with the gameplay. It has its share of bugs, but so far the team at Runic has been on top of them and the gameplay has improved since launch. Possibly he best thing about his game, However, is the graphics. If i was to try to compare them to anything I would say they were like Borderlands, Dark cloud and Bastion had a three way love child. I think I might come home on occasion and just climb up to a viewpoint and chill. The vistas in the game are truly beautiful, and I think the best I have seen in a game for a long time. Anyone who is waffling on buying this game should take the plunge, it is truly awesome.

35430621.review:
Hob is full of all my favorite aesthetic things. Beautiful environments, ambient creatures, and an atmospheric soundtrack. 

The combat isn't too tough and the puzzles are pretty simple, which is fine by me. Simply wandering around is a huge chunk of the fun. The game has a strong sense of mood and the exploration feels satisfying every time you discover a new biome. 

There are a couple bugs that have popped up, the game crashed once but the autosave feature in Hob makes it so that the loss from a crash is very minimal. I never felt like a crash was a setback beyond just restarting my game. It sounds like the devs are close to solving that bug, so it doesn't seem like a huge deal.

Overall really solid game, I enjoyed Torchlight and Torchlight 2, really happy to say the same about Hob.

35424562.review:
Sense of wonder. That's what I'm enjoying about Hob. It provides a lush and gentle atmosphere packed with enticing mysteries. You're not a gritty hero; from the sound effects used, you might actually be a little kid. So  you get this sense of real vulnerability, but also, more than almost any game I've played in the last few years, Hob makes you feel incredibly powerful and able to move mountains with just a wave of your giant robot hand.
A+ for that feeling.
I've had no issues running the game with a 1050ti nVidia card. Sorry to hear so many are hindered from enjoying it.

35424048.review:
优秀的解密游戏，13个小时通关，然而我是手残，不停的摔死+被带着护甲的强力怪按在地上摩擦……强烈推荐喜欢解密游戏，并且不喜欢战斗的风景党玩家们~

优点：
美术风格（对这种风格没有抵抗力）
部分解密（设计的很精巧~）
地图设计（转角遇到[strike]  爱  [/strike]收集品~）
机关设置（巨大的城市从地底升起，超级帅）
风景（这似乎也算是美术的一部分？好几处[strike]  同步点  [/strike]观察点都好漂亮~）

缺点：
没啥存在感的音乐（还好没有买BGM包，另外音乐给我一种双子传说BGM的错觉）
操作（转动机关无论我往哪个方向推摇杆，小人就是不动）
地图设计（望山跑死马，尤其是在没有开近路的情况下……）
卡视角卡位（我本来就手残，固定视角后，我摔死了N次……还有被看似平地的地砖卡住被按在地上摩擦……）
bug（穿墙，掉树丛，卡台阶……最后只能重生以谢天下）
提示（无论是按键提示还是剧情提示还是地图提示都少得可怜……我第一次遇到那个电池，因为站位不对，没有提示还以为没法捡起来然后卡关了半个小时……）


最后要说~作为一款解密游戏专注解密没有什么幺蛾子[spoiler]困难的[/spoiler]战斗[spoiler]对于手残玩家来说[/spoiler]真是完美啊~

35413117.review:
I don't normally play platformers or puzzle games so I was surprised when I found myself loving Hob so much. It's charming and fun, repairing the world is satisfying; yes, it's not very challenging but to me it's a plus when I just want to relax and make progress.

I'm using a gamepad as recommended and the movement and combat are very fluid. And while I'm a big fan of Torchlight II I definitely don't mind getting Hob before TL III. Yes, it's different but nothing is wrong with that.

Though I should note that I'm the kind of person who doesn't mind it when games get repetitive when the repeated action is fun enough. So if you just want hack-and-slash action, Hob's not for you. It's definitely more puzzle- and exploration-oriented.

35412952.review:
Enjoyed the game very much, kind of hated one ending. I hope Hob will be the start of a series of games around this world.
As an older gamer lacking the reaction times for the fights and playing on an DELL xps 9560 with medium graphics and easy game mode i found almost the whole game pretty smooth. A no fight mode with just the riddles would make the game even better for me. Had to look up my prefered ending on YouTube as the final fight was by far to difficult for me even with easy settings. 

Pro:
- a world beyond your imagination, completely fresh, i hope for more storys from this world
- for my taste very nice graphics with soothing music which reminds me of times long gone in diablos tristram ;-)
- riddles and world are some of the best i have seen, all but one where solvable without help, did not find the start
- very easy to get in the flow, one more puzzle, one more checkpoint, one more collectable ;-)
- took me 20 hours to solve, so 1 Euro per hour, very very high value for your money
- first game i played completely with controller(required!!!), after hundreds of games with mouse/keyboard surprisinly good!

Cons (buy and play it, these are just to warn you!):
- i hate the save system, could not find out how to save my progress to show some sequences again to my wife. wtf?
- while kind of related to the story, the fights did not help me to enjoy the world, i could very well live without them.
- if you do not figure out the save system, you can not go back the complete the world beyond some point at the end.
- never had a console, i assume Hob is pretty much like a console game, so i will never own a console.

I expect to play this game again for my wife in spectator mode, as an avid WoW player (have been, too), a game depending on a controller is completely unplayable for her.

Looking forward to Hob 2 - Hob 10 ;-)

35412084.review:
About 5 hours in and I am enthralled by Hob, a beautiful action/exploration/puzzle RPG.

Hob is very different from the previous Runic games (the highly recommended Torchlight games), but has it's own charm.

Combat is light and not overly challenging, but the main focus here seems to be the puzzle/exploration experience. If you are after a relaxing, take it at your own pace type of game this will fill that niche nicely.

For the headache sufferers this game has no ultra tense moments (so far) and the simple, infrequent combat allows you to play without too much stress and therefore seems suitable for 'light' gaming if you are afflicted with a headache. Frequent save points also allow you to pick up/put down at short notice without losing your progress. Recommended. 

(Also reviewed by me via the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/HeadachesandMigraines]Headache & Migraine Gaming Group[/url])

35411730.review:
手残党历时10个小时，终于是通关了。
作为能够制作出《火炬之光》系列游戏的团队，其实力肯定是毋庸置疑的。
好，吹完厂商来说剧情吧。
总体来说剧情还不错，虽然有点短，也没有任何明显的字面提示，但是完全可以看得懂。主要讲的是，主人公被机器人壮汉（雾）唤♂醒后，拯救世界或者毁灭世界的故事（结局什么的，还是自己去体验一番为好。）。我个人对游戏中密集的紫色脓包和尖刺触手是非常的深恶痛绝！每次多看两眼都会起一身鸡皮疙瘩。
游戏中有些不值一提的卡位BUG，只需要点击菜单，然后重生即可。（反正我个人是自爆了无数次……关于什么5次死亡通过和5小时通关的成就是绝对不存在的！）
关于怪物：遇到普通型怪物就是怼怼怼！遇到壮汉型怪物，大概就要开启黑魂模式了。
关于找路：前期在你出生地的那两只精灵，就不要绞尽脑汁去救了。等你修好水，拿到全部的手臂部件就会迎刃而解（其实这游戏还是有任务提示的~就是那个菱形小方块。当你救出五个精灵之后，他就不会再提示了。这时候，就需要去把之前无从下手的两只救出来，就可以继续推进剧情了。）
如果无限迷路的话……（除了多仔细看看，我还能说什么呢~摊手.jpg）→我个人最神秘的一次是，在藤曼就在我的脚底，但我眼瞎的就是没看见，死了七八次，捉摸了四十分钟才看到那个小洞。果然，解谜游戏是需要视力了！
————————
就说这些吧，不追求全收集的话，差不多就是5-10小时的流程，算是比较短了，但是蛮有意思的。至少我看到主角跌落在地，biaji~的一下四分五裂时……还是感觉挺好笑的……2333。
新人第一次写评测，希望有所帮助。

35410337.review:
Almost 7 hours to complete it and I can say yes, I think is worth the time. Runic Games decided to make something different from Torchlight and Hob was the result.  Not a complicated game in any point quite simple but sometimes you need to explore to find the right path.

The combat system is more of the same, you can unlock some extra "upgrades" but if you don't go for those the game will not be especially more difficult. The story is there but is not really deep and 2 endings which can be both obtained at the end. The soundtrack is good and I don't know why but I got it for free, maybe because I have also both Torchlight?

To get the 100% the game could take easy at least 3 or 4 more hours and maybe less depending of your knowledge of the map and how fast you can go. All objects and collectibles appear in the map once you get close enough so no pressure, I'll might go for it in the future.

One thing that was a problem sometimes is the camera. Because of the level design and how thin are some paths I failed more jumps that I would like dying in the process.

I general a good experience and a relax adventure, in my case no question. I recommend it 100%

35403637.review:
This game is basically Ico-light Drifter (3D) - that should get you salivating, right?

The combat is much easier than Hyperlight Drifter, and the platforming is far more forgiving than Ico - It'll generally understand where you were trying to go and not punsh you for being a pixel off.  I don't consider these negatives!

On the downside for some people, you will spend a lot of time just running around wondering WTF you're supposed to do next, which is 8-bit RPG Represent.  But it's purty so I don't mind so much just running around.  Actually, the 3D complexity of the maps reminds me of the old Dreamcast game E.G.G.  You'll get used to what the game expects of you.  

Just realize that ground pound is A, then Y, not A and Y together.  And buy the shield first!

35403619.review: Very interesting environments and level design, and fun to play! There are still a few bugs that need to be patched, like sounds still playing when sound is muted, some noclipping and border skips, some crashes I had at the beginning of the game etc, but it doesn't subtract from how fun the game is. It's also always nice to see narrative evolving in videogames, because Hob's story is not all "in your face", since there is no actual English in the world itself, much like in Hyper Light Drifter. I'm sure there will be people who have figured the entire backstory out, but I'm afraid I don't completely understand it except for the big and obvious stuff. The world can be a bit disorienting and complex at times, so I did find myself looking at my map for direction sometimes. At times I wasn't sure what to do, but perseverance and looking at the objective markers often helped. Definitely worth the buy!

35402816.review:
ラピュタっぽい世界を冒険するパズル要素ありのアクションゲーム。
ギミックのすべてがラピュタっぽくダイナミックに動くので、
やってることはただスイッチ操作するだけなんですが、魅せられます。

アクションもパズル要素も難易度は比較的低めで、ストレスなく自力クリアできるレベル。
視点を自由に操作できないので先がどうなってるのか分かりにくくその分難易度は上がるんだけど、
逆に、視点を誘導されてヒントも分かりやすいように設定されてる感じです。

オープンワールドなんだけど、終盤までは攻略順序は1本道。
とは言え、いろんな場所を探し回って次のルートを見つける必要があり、やらされてる感は低めです。

登場するキャラクターは理解できる言葉を話さないので、自分で色んなことを試してみて、
「ああ、そういうことか！」という発見から、小さな満足感と達成感が積み重なっていくゲーム体験でした。

エンディングはアッサリ系で、クリア後も探索は続けられますが、
ストーリーを進めるのに関係ないルートは全体の2割ぐらいと思われるので、
クリア後のマップ開拓は一瞬で終わりました。

ただ、全アイテム収集はかなり時間がかかりそうです。
ストーリー進めるのとはレベルが違う難易度で道を探す必要がある箇所も多く、剣Lv4までの道が長い・・・。
（剣Lvを最大まで上げないと開かない扉もあるので、クリア後のお楽しみ要素となっています。）

大人になってからはまともにゲームをクリアする体力も好奇心も無くなった私でも、
クリアまで夢中でプレイできた作品だったと思います。

35399853.review:
O aspecto mais interessante de Hob, e aquele que o diferencia de outros jogos similares, é a forma como o mundo se desdobra diante do jogador. Ainda existe um mapa vasto, e cada área do mapa se torna acessível com o tempo, conforme o jogador avança em sua aventura. Porém, ao invés de locais prontos, esperando para serem visitados, o mundo de Hob funciona como um gigantesco quebra-cabeças. Planícies, florestas, desertos, montanhas. Cada pedaço do mundo é uma peça gigantesca, uma mistura de matéria inorgânica e engenhosidade tecnológica. Cabe ao jogador, então, deslocar essas peças, de modo a desbloquear novos caminhos.
(...)
Da mesma forma que o mundo, em geral, os pequenos elementos de Hob também se inspiram na mesma construção por peças de quebra-cabeças. O braço biônico, origem dos poderes utilizados pelo protagonista, ganha pedaços adicionais ao longo do jogo, que desbloqueiam novas habilidades e mudam a aparência da ferramenta. A espada, arma principal contra inimigos, também pode sofrer alterações, se tornando mais poderosa. Mais uma vez, o incremento é representado visualmente por um novo agrupamento de peças móveis.
(...)
Para ajudar na navegação, além de um mapa detalhado, que mostra a posição de colecionáveis já vistos, o mundo de Hob é rico em sua fauna e flora. A ideia da Runic Games foi desenvolver um local neutro, em que tudo o que representasse perigo fosse apenas uma consequência da tentativa de sobrevivência de diferentes espécies. Isso significa que há criaturas que irão te atacar, enquanto outras são completamente indefesas. E como não há um time inimigo, todos os ataques desferidos por qualquer ser afetam as criaturas a seu redor. É possível, dessa forma, utilizar golpes de inimigos para derrotar outros seres hostis.
(...)
A câmera. Se fossemos listar qual é o maior problema de cada jogo, sem nenhuma dúvida uma câmera ruim estaria no topo do ranking de maiores falhas. A câmera de Hob é fixa, e o jogador não pode controlar nenhum aspecto da visibilidade. Isso significa que o estúdio programou cada mudança de perspectiva que ocorre entre salas diferentes do mesmo cenário. O resultado final não é de todo ruim, e funciona durante a maior parte do jogo. Mas o motivo principal de morte em Hob é a dificuldade de realizar um salto sobre um abismo quando o ângulo de visão não é natural.
Esse problema é sentido principalmente nas últimas seções do jogo, e em algumas áreas opcionais. Isso porque a exigência de precisão aumenta, bem como o número de poderes de deslocamento utilizados. Com a complexidade, vem também a frustração de não conseguir realizar determinado movimento porque a câmera prejudica o entendimento do jogo das direções para as quais o jogador tenta seguir.

35397110.review:
So as a gamer getting on in years, it's been harder and harder to find something that really pulls me in.  So many of the big games seem to want a deep committment of time before they get good.  Others start good but soon turn into a grind, revealing its shallowness.  Sometimes I wonder if I'm outgrowing games and will have to take up gardening or something.

Luckily Hob has come along.  Hob has been fun from the beginning and is still fun.  New mechanics, zones, and story elements are introduced regularly and I'm having a great time.  The pace is not hectic, and the visuals are beautiful.  Eventually I'll finish it, but I actually think it might be worth a replay.  Watching the world evolve is been a unique experience, and it would be worthwhile to watch it again from the beginning.

Many have compared Hob to other games, but I don't think anyone has compared it to 'The Room' series of games.  The way the puzzles work and the way pieces of the landscape fit together remind me on it.

I have a pretty mediocre computer, but have had no issues with this game; it plays pretty smooth.  I've played most of it up until now with a keyboard and mouse, and it wasn't too bad.  But I just splurged on a controller and it makes the game much more enjoyable.  I didn't find the platforming hard with the K&M but combat was a chore.  Now it feels much more fluid.

It's disappointing this game hasn't received more buzz.  If you're sitting the fence I recommend you give it a try.

EDIT: Finally finished it.  Some have claimed to do it it in 7 hours but it took me twice that.  Except for a brief period at the beginning (when I focused on an objective I couldn't yet achieve) I never was at a loss for something to do, and it seems like you can hit the main objectives in different orders.  I still have many secrets I haven't found, however. There are at least two endings, and the game lets you 'continue' after you've experienced one to try the other.  The endings are open to interpretation; I'm still puzzling out what they mean. Which is good!

In summary, I'd say this is one of the best games I've played in a while.  Awesome style, gameplay, and value.  I want to thank the developers for the great memories.

35395517.review:
[b]A zelda-like with fun combat, and moments of wonder, but plagued by a couple of unwise design choices. Ultimately a recommendation, nonetheless. [/b]

Using a controller IS recommended. Mouse + keyboard ain't too bad, but the experience is definitely tailored for the controller.

The games good in the ways you'd expect. Combat's fun and you've got a big ol' world with many secrets to find and places to explore. Art style's neat and there's unlockable abilities along the way, that while few, are fun to use and spaced out well. 

[b]However there are a few notable downsides.[/b]

While the soundscape of the world is nice and well made, a lack of real music leaves a distinct lack of character to the world. That's right, there is almost no OST.

The overworld is a clear derivative of the developers work on Torchlight, but far too often leaves you without direction. You know the games that make you go "wtf where do i go, what do i doooooo..."? Yeah, that.

This game lack dialog entirely. This isn't a bad thing in of itself, but most good games that do this tell their stories in other clever ways. This lacks such an alternative. After finishing the game I felt I understood very little about the world, which untimately left the ending feeling very unsatisfying.

This games overworld (where you spend the majority of your time) suffers from some pretty severe frame drops, which is a real shame. I upgraded PC recently, and was shocked to still be experiencing such issues.

[b]I enjoyed my time in this game for the most part. I'd say it's pretty good for a £15 game, though I am sad that it wasn't that little bit above "good" to become "great".[/b]

35393749.review:
Hob is really a delightful game with many puzzles to solve that can leave you stumped for a quite a bit. Perfectly fine for those who don't mind being confused by a game every now and then but everything is definitley solveable. But the glorious thing about these puzzles is, is that you can go somewhere else to fill your time. Definitely not immediately is everything able to be solved due to needing power ups and ability upgrades. Which is also a nice feature to be able to upgrade your character, which will push you to find all the small hidden paths to get currency, hp and energy. They really are delightful and fulfilling to find once you have finally figured out how to get to some things that are in sight but unreachable at certain points. If you enjoy back tracking to certain areas after pushing further and further in the game, to solve certain things you couldn't before then you will like Hob, this game has plenty of that. There is a story here, but there is 0 dialogue and you have to watch everything as it happens around you to learn what exactly the story is about. It's not hard to grasp but you may miss some things if you are not paying attention. The game has enough to thrive on through just gameplay if you're not interested in the story. 

Pros:
- Puzzle solving is fulfilling
- Atmosphere/Art 
- Upgrading abilities and Character
- Secrets to find
- Platforming is great to figure out and becomes more interesting with the introduction of some power-ups (adds to the puzzle solving aspect)
- Controls are fluid

Cons: 
- Enemy mechanics get stale
- Camera is unadjustable which may lead to (many) deaths from the platforming

Pros/Cons:
- Do not get if you are easily frustrated by not being able to figure out what to do next. This game does not hold your hand. It definitely gives you a push in the right direction but will not help you plainly figure out what/where to do/go next.

TL;DR If you are looking for a game that has story and you don't mind no dialogue with great gameplay and puzzle solving that will not hold your hand then this is the game for you.
