• Des puzzle et des zone caché pour toute les difficultées, autant certains puzzles sont d'un simplicité abérante, autant d'autres demanderons de se poser quelques temps et de réfléchire. Quand au zones cachés elle sont inombrables certaines sont comme sur notre route, en tant que joueur qui aime fouiller et chercher ça et là je suis ravis, d'autant que certaines zones sont caché abilement.
• Une bande son au petits oignons, après falais s'en douté c'est Matt Uelmen tout de même (il à fait les musiques de Diablo / Diablo II / World of Warcraft : Burning Crusade / Torchlight / Torchlight II) donc autant dire qu'il faut s'attendre à du niveau. Et sa marche ! Je veut dire qu'on se laisse volontier emporté par d'aussi belles musiques d'ambiances en sachant que jamais ont ne les trouves vraiment répétitive, le fait aussi que chaque lieu et zone à sa musique jous énormément sur la beautée du titre. (Encore un petit plus, la BO est disponnible avec l'achat du jeu donc un vrai plaisir !)
• Certains passagent pourrait paraitre long et au moment ou on pourrais commencé à se lassé, Hop changement radical de décort. Un grand plus pour les gens comme moi qui se lassent très vite.
• Et évidement comment parler de HOB sans parler de sa technique ? C'est à dire que on passe notre temps à explorer ce monde merveilleux et par l'appuis d'un simple boutton le monde se tranforme devant nos yeux, on reconnait bien certains endroits mais rien n'est pareil, une plaine peut se changer en rivère, des montagnes disparaissent pour ne laisser qu'un surface plane. Bref. Jamais on ne s'ennui avec HOB.
• Ah oui aussi vu que je suis nul, je meur beaucoup car je suis une vrai quiche aux jeux de platforme. Et bien on aprécie réelement les checkpoints réguliers + téléporteur entres les zones et le respawn rapide.
• C'est beau ! Non je ne parle pas de graphisme mais de paysages et de level design. Car se dire que tout ce qu'on voit dans le décor c'est glabalement jouable, c'est fou. Un tuyau dans le décor ? Ah bah non il n'est pas là que pour faire joli c'est peu etre un endroit secret ou alors tu y passera plus tard. Enfin voilà rarement vu un level design aussi riche. De plus que les quelques points ça et là ou on peut juste s'assoire dans le jeu et contempler le paysage sont les bien venu et vu que l'interface n'est pas envahissante et disparait quand il n'y en à pas besoin, et bien vous pouvez faire de magnifiques catures d'écrant ou juste contempler car c'est beau, vraiment ! 

Les moins :
• Bon je dis depuis tout à l'heure que le jeu est sublime etc, mais il est vrai qu'a sa sortie on à eu le droit à quelques bugs qui je ne doute pas vont vite être corrigé. J'ai pour exemple que il m'est arrivé à quelques reprises (3 exactement mais je n'ai pas encore fini d'y jouer croyez moi ! ♥) de soit rentré dans un mur, ou alors de ne pas pouvoir monter une platforme avant la 15aine de reprise en faisant la même chose. Mais voilà laissons le temps au jeu de corriger ses quelques bugs, de plus rien de génant pour jouer.
• Une lisibilité quelques fois handicapé à cause de la caméra (qui est fixe / 100% controlé par le jeu), la caméra dans son ensemble sers énormément à la beautée du titre qui avec une caméra 100% controlé par le joueur nous laisserais passé à coté de beaucoups de paysages et autres choses magnifiques. Juste donner là possibilité de bouger de quelques centimètre avec le stick droit pour par exemple mieux jauger une distance ou ce genre de chause, aurrait été fort plaisant.

BREF ! J'èspère vous avoir guidé dans votre achat.

更新补丁后好一点，掉帧的情况虽然还是时常发生，但比之前好很多。

可惜流程觉得还是有点短（中间大概有几个小时吃饭没关游戏），
而且有点不合理，手套技能都拿了后就没几个新区域了。

35261768.review:
If you like adventure games this is a must own! This game is very well done and Runic has outdone themselves. The visual style is absolutly stunning and the game play is simple yet very effective. There is a ton of things to figure out, collect, and unlock. Having the ability to upgrade as you go and learn about the world and what has taken place.

The story is very unique in that there is no dialog, but translated via the emotion and variance "voices". The sound is a very import cue in this game. At different points the mood of the sound as well as effects from doing things, portray what is going on. It's like story through emotion and sound.

Again if you are looking for a high quality, well done adventure game, this game is it. It's more than worth the money that you spend on it. I'm surprised at how cheap the price is considering the amount of content that is in the game.

35260283.review:
肝了13个小时，总算通关了。给新手几点提示吧：

1.这游戏悬崖贼多，而且没有空气墙的， 所以当你在悬崖边上跑跳的时候，尽量不要按加速。
2.当你进副本的时候，打开菜单键是没有地图的，只会显示出当前副本你有哪些东西没有收集。
3.游戏过程中，请随时注意观察你周边的墙啊，路啊等等。因为他们可能就是你去往下一个区域的关键。
4.当你觉得卡关了，不妨回之前的地方看看，是不是有新的路可以走。
5.游戏一共3种能力，蓄力拳；瞬移；勾爪？。当你拿齐之后就可以安心找路了。
6.[spoiler] 结局有两个选择，一个是伸手（应该是表示谅解女王？），另一个是拔剑，之后就是跟他边上的人打一架，然后你成为新的王。选择困难症请放心，不管选哪个，最后完了之后继续游戏会在结局之前那个存档点出来的[/spoiler]（结局剧透）

最后想说的就是，一定要细心，细心，再细心的观察你走过的路和墙！不然之后你可能面临满地图跑着找路的后果！

35259453.review:
What a fantastic game!

although this game has many flaws it also has so much going for it that it may just be my game of the year for 2017.

Pros:
Currently running on an i7-4770, GTX 780 with 16GB RAM and never once went below 80FPS with max settings
Beautiful scenery and landscapes
interesting comabt
very rewarding puzzles even though most are simple they fill you with a feeling of accomplishment 
just the right length for a game like this
ran almost perfectly (few graphical errors)
Extremely engaging always making question "what comes next?"

Cons:
Can sometimes be confusing as to where to go next once you stop getting the blinking indicator on the map
Some things aren't explained well within the game (could be a Pro if you're into that)
No real boss fights excluding the ending depending on which you choose(who was pathetically easy on hard).

This game has a beautiful way of telling the story without using any understadable words, find lore throughout the world and learn from what you see. It took me a total of 7 hours to beat the game on my first playthrough(hard mode) without collecting all the upgrades (i did get all the sword parts and lore) but I did spend quite a while exploring and looking at all the vistas. After getting a basic idea of where I was going I then did another run in just under 3 hours. I would say it would take the average player 5-6 hours to beat on the first playthrough.
I honestly can't explain why I enjoyed this game so much but it was such a ride with very few moments where there was either no action or no puzzles, it was a none stop very well written journey.
Only thing that I found really disapointing was the lack of boss fights which I think would have been a great addition to each dungeon to change the pace of the game a bit.
£14.99 for this game seems about right based on how long it took to beat, but for the sheer enjoyment it gave me then it's an absolute steal at that price.

I advise everyone to try this game and fall in love with the cute little weird flower things like I did

TLDR:
Buy it

HOB给我的感觉像3D版的ORI，
优点：剧情内容很丰富，画面很美，有不少看风景的点，都能截图当背景，音乐还行，手柄操作感好（怪物挺好打的）

。
。
。
。
。
主角生活的世界被一种紫色的东西（病毒？会感染的都是病毒）侵占了，主角在机器人的帮助下打开水源，清理被感染变异的生物，最后打到飞船上去（BOSS在天上），这里会有游戏唯一的选择处，选择投靠或者杀死女王（BOSS）

游戏结束后还可以继续游玩，推荐先选投靠BOSS的拿个成就，然后选择干死女王。

35254320.review:
Firstly, if you're having optimization issues, turn on Vsync to cap your frames. I have a GTX 1080 and was crashing every few minutes before I did so. Now on to the meat of it...

Pros:

This game is the poor man's Breath of the Wild. It's a perfect blend of Zelda and Metroidvania puzzling. The art is cell shaded which is a big plus in my book.

Neutrals:

Combat is meh. I'm on very hard, and it's laughable. The puzzling isn't difficult, but at times, the game seems artificially difficult when you miss a small path that's critical to solving one. 

Cons:

Optimization is still kind of spotty. It's a bit slow. I am patient, but Jesus, it can drag at times. 

Tl;dr purchase if you like metroidvania/zelda adventures and turn on vsync.

35254297.review:
美术风格很棒的一款动作解密类游戏，地图设计真的很精巧，玩法上有点战神的味道。
但是游戏也有两个很迷的问题，一个是这游戏是锁视角的，但是一般锁视角的游戏（比如战神）在悬崖边都会有空气墙防止你误操作摔死（除非你自己作死跳下去），然而这游戏却没有这种设定，在羊肠小道上各种摔死，体验有点差。还有一个问题就是游戏的优化，1070的显卡玩这游戏在一些场景居然会掉帧，而且掉帧还是比较频繁的，让人有些无法忍受，希望制作组能尽快搞定这些问题。

35254208.review:
퍼즐이 어렵지 않다. 상대적으로 난이도를 비교하자면 림보와 인사이드처럼 필드어딘가의 부품을 끼워맞춰서 진행하는 형식.

처음 게임을 시작하면 주인공이 스폰한 원형의 땅 기준으로 동서남북 8방향으로 차근차근 맵을 밝혀나가며 퍼즐과 스토리를 풀어나가는 방식.

갈림길도 단순한 A.B 갈림길밖에 없으며 예로 들어 A는 스토리 진행,  B는 숨겨져있는 수집요소 및 강화재료가 있으며 한번 지나간 길을 지나치게 반복적으로 왔다갔다 할 필요가 없을정도로 쾌적한 퍼즐길.

중간중간에 나오는 보스와 잡몹은 패턴이 단순하여 회피기와 마우스 평타질로 충분히 잡을수있어 번거로운 일을 하지 않아도 됨.

단 잡몹은 이동 텔포를 타거나 그지역을 벗어나면 리젠.

강화요소와 무기강화재료는 퍼즐을 풀면서 A.B 갈래길 한번씩 지나가주면 빠지지않고 먹을 수있어 간편함.

고로 날잡고 주말에 맥주나 음료수 한두잔 여유를 부리면서 느긋하게 하는 게임.

35251342.review:
Given the magic that's literally this game's theme, I already can't recommend it. Wasn't intending on going over the 2hr. limit, but lo and behold I've lost my $50 EC to the dregs of time. [Why there isn't a rent option on Steam, I don't know.]

Funnily enough, that's not the only issue that wants to make itself glaringly apparent. There is a lot of running back and forth in this game, as is expected, but it becomes glaringly annoying when you get to a point that's right in front of the thing you have to get to, looks like you can reasonably walk or jump to it, and then get your hopes, dreams, aspirations and patience (much of which has dwindled down from all the zigzagging nowhere) blocked off by and cast into the chaos that is invisible walls. Granted this would be rectified by the time you figure it out, giving you a sense of accomplishment. For me it's just continual annoyance at how much this game costs even at pre-order price.

So when you figure out one confusingly area-wide puzzle. you are then faced with the next question: where the hobscat do I go now? The map only helps to an extent, probably for good reason. But then there's those other times when you get to a thing at the south of the screen that looks attainable from where you're standing, but can't. 

Which brings us to the elephant's flatulent infant: the camera. I know the whole point of the camera switching from top-down perspective to 3D is to get a gander at the scenery and even actually show you where the thing you're supposed to get to is, but: 
- the theme of the game already ruined the first for me to begin with.
- after you go past this point, finish dealing with it and have to take the path back, you have to deal with it again. This isn't helped by the fact that even on the lowest settings, in open areas, even underwater at times, the game lags immensely. It also seems that the camera is actually an elephant when it does this as it struggles to actually keep up with you, and if you're running off to a cliff facing ground 3-4 blocks below you, tough luck.

Combat's alright, but not as fleshed out as it could've been. The decision to make the moveset expandable through schematics well-hidden in areas seems like a good move....then you realize that some of these moves are just common sense to have on the get-go, and by the time you get them, you might actually be on your way to finishing the game: unless you're stuck dealing with the amazing question of where to go and what needs to be done to get a move on. Not to mention one of your abilities gets no love after its acquisition. You don't even get to use it on enemies unless they have certain things to target with it. Really? The one other legit power you get aside from your charge fist and you don't even try to flesh that out, Runic? I know the enemy variety is scarce but sheesh.

All in all: don't buy this game. My own "bias" aside, you're more than likely to waste a bunch of minutes just trying to figure out where you have to go, then going to the same spot constantly before you get to how scarce the game feels on the ~action~ side of things. And when you do get to where the game "gets good," your disappointment will be worsened by the fact that you can't get a refund.

- A salty review written by a moron who went too far to get a refund.

35250200.review:
Disclosure-I haven't played the game all that long so this is based upon initial first impression. I also am friends with some of the devs but whilte I was given a Beta key it was after i'd already been gifted the game by a (non-developer) friend. Even so I've indicated that I did receive a copy from Runic. That said here's my initial review which I will update as soon as I finish the game. Feel free to ask me any questions in regards to the game and I'll do my best to answer them. 

I love the way this game communicates ideas without using a known language. it's like watching a Jim Henson production. Like Dark Crystal where the Skesis had this strange language and communicated via noises yet you could immediately tell what they were 'saying' via body language. Kudo's to the animators who worked on this because that part is amazing.I do wish It zoomed a little closer in during those few short but sweet dialog moments. Then again I wish we could zoom in in general. I'd really love to take a closer look at all the creatures. The creature design in this game is so fantastic. 

My biggest issue is getting lost and not having any idea where to go. There are things I can't access because I lack upgrades and the areas are so big I end up losing track of where I've been. Checking the map doesn't help as it's a bit confusing to read. I'm not usually this terrible at games like this which leads to my getting frustrated now and then. Fortunately the 'Ah!' moments and story more than make up for it. Visual-wise however this is a beautiful game. Runic has managed to create a style of artwork that stands out from the rest of the games I've played over the last few years. Most textures have an almost animated quality to them with rich mood-setting colors breathing life into its naturalistic world. It features a mix of natural and steampunk yet without it being cliche. It feels like the setting is its own time and place rather than trying to fit into a specific genre. 

The character designs are all unique and help add to the feeling of this place being a real live world. My only nitpick about it is that the ground textures seem almost an afterthought and a bit too simplistic compared to the rest of the environment. It pulls you out of the world a bit so hopefully they'll give those an upgrade at some point. 

The music is wonderful and deserves its own section. A little surprising given I'm used to Matt Uelmen's music being a bit more thematic but the looser, more mystical nature of the melodies fits perfectly. It sounds wonderful through headphones and really blands in with the environmental sounds. It melds into this cohesive living landscape of sound that makes the environment feel so much more alive. There are all these little rhythmic touches that hearken back to his older work yet never in a way that sounds too derivative. Instead it sounds like the result of a gradual maturation of skill. As much as I love his past scores I'd consider this his best work yet. So much more subtle that his previous work but that's what makes it all the more magical.

I can tell that this games maps are a definite progression from Torchlight and Torchlight II's. The way everything fits together seems almost haphazard at first but then when you start to piece things together it starts making you feel like you're just barely uncovering pieces of this huge living machine. It's rather breathtaking in scope at times. I guess that's why I'm getting so frustrated. I want to see more of this amazing world. It can be a head-scratcher and calls for a measure of patience but the thrill of seeing the entire world around you change is worth its more frustrating moments. It's great for those looking for a mix of exploration with a bit of combat but if you're looking for pure action it's probably not for you. You're going to spend more time looking for clues and solving puzzles than you are fighting and what fighting there is seems to be a bit shallow. 

All in all It's a really great if at times a little frustrating puzzle/platformer full of Henson-like characters and moodiness reminiscent of films like The Dark Crystal or animated films like Don Bluth's Secret of Nimh.

35248508.review: Raising and cleansing Hob’s world was, for the most part, a good time. Nicely-flowing puzzles and platforming with a massive result in literally shifting the world around, coupled with combat encounters that were sensibly placed made sure of that. This persisted until the final third/quarter, where things started feeling too alike and its mishandling of its wordless narrative became evident. To be honest, for that portion of the game, I was left without much purpose and the conclusion, well, it did little to change anything. I really wish Hob had managed to keep me engaged until the end, be it through more varied puzzles, mechanics, encounters or more significant discoveries. With that in mind, the game does have enough things going for itself to make it worth the time of those who raise an eyebrow at the thought of exploring and awakening a mysterious world using gauntlet, brain and, sometimes, brawn.[url=http://www.noobfeed.com/reviews/1356/hob-pc-review] Full Review[/url].

35246370.review:
3h de jeux déjà et je m'arrête par priorité car j'y aurais jouer la nuit entière !
Un zelda en therme de style oui mais revisité ! sans compté que l'histoire à vraiment l'air génial !
Le level design part dans tout les sens: horizontalité, verticalité, on se perd dans l'environnement et on fini à chaque fois par découvrir quelques choses, c'est juste génial ! En plus de ça, la map à l'air assez grande pour ce type de jeu, sachant qu'elle ne reflette que le monde en 2D ^^

Note que une fonctionnalité est étrange pour moi, les ennemies ne reprennent pas de vie après la mort du héro, ce qui fait que tout les monstres sont batable, même sans skill et c'est dommage. Je joue dans la difficulté max et au lieu de perfectionner mes reflexes sur le jeu, les monstres finissent forcement par mourrir au bout de 2-3 respawn.

Peut être une possibilité d'avoir une régénération des mobs dans des difficultés élevées serait pas mal !

Sinon n'hésiter pas, si vous aimez les histoires poétiques, les environnements beau et bien construit et une faune spécial mais plaisante vous aimerez ce jeu.

35244314.review:
広大な謎の遺跡をパズルを解きながら、ときにモンスターと戦ったりしつつ探索してゆくゲーム。某天空の城と某超構造体を足してゼルダで割ったような世界観。主役はキャラクターよりも遺跡そのもの、というくらい地形の作りこみが凄い。
　ローディング中のTipsとアビリティの説明以外は、ほぼテキストが存在しないので、登場人物のしぐさから物語を想像するほかなく、どんな舞台なのか、主人公は誰なのか、何も分からないまま旅が続きますが、一貫性のあるマップのデザインから、主人公と彼を助けてくれた謎のロボットの素性が、なんとなく推測できるようになっています。

[h1]良いところ[/h1]
+キャラクターの仕草が細かく丁寧
+ゲームのテンポを損なわない程度に調整された難易度のギミック
+縦方向にも横方向にもダイナミックに変化する地形
+インタラクトできる場所は光っていたり、押すべきボタンが表示される親切設計
+初見殺しというほどではないが、死ぬときはあっさり死ぬのでチェックポイントは多め
+自然な難易度上昇
+洋ゲーらしいグロい死に様
+ヌルゲーマーの私にはちょうどいい戦闘の難易度

[h1]悪いところ[/h1]
-箱を移動しようとして、その箱に登ってしまったりするのが地味にストレス
-意図的な仕様だと思いますが、マップ上のアイコンの意味が掴みづらい
-洋ゲーらしいグロい死に様
-ハードコアゲーマーには少し物足りないであろう戦闘の難易度


面倒にならない程度に探索しないと見つからない隠し要素もありますが、マップ自体はオープンワールドとはいえ、進行度によって行動範囲が決まっているので、基本的には寄り道できる一本道のゲームと考えていいかなと思います。もっとも、これを書いている時点の進行度は４つめのバイオームあたり(おそらくまだ序盤)なので、後半になるともっと行動の自由が広がるのかもしれません。

Torchlightシリーズ同様、Runic Gamesらしい、とても丁寧に作られた作品だと思います。
お値段もおてごろです。
おすすめです。

玩了2小时左右，先来评一波：

优点：舒服的画面，流畅的角色动作，中规中矩的获得能力开新图的玩法（比较接近于塞尔达）。

缺点：不太流畅的战斗，十分拙计的优化。

总结：推荐喜欢动作冒险+解谜的玩家购买（塞尔达，暗黑血统），游戏素质尚佳，价格也不贵，可以一玩。但是目前的运行效率十分的拙计，战斗的不流畅很大程度上也是由于频繁的掉帧所至，希望官方可以尽快推出更流畅的版本。

------------

10月2日补充：

关掉垂直同步能非常大的改善性能，游戏在复杂场景会瞬间掉帧50%以上，开垂直帧数会掉到30帧以下从而造成明显的卡顿，但是关掉垂直后一般帧数都在250帧左右，即使掉帧依然有100帧以上，基本感觉不到。

35242516.review:
This is one of the best games I've played this year so far, and it was only $20.

Imagine if Zelda and Journey has a baby and it was a metroidvania title. Thats Hob. Its combat is simplistic yet has depth to it. It can be button mashy (especially in the beginning) but as the game goes on the enemies become harder and the combat begins to evolve and get deeper. 

The puzzles are challenging and fun to solve, similar to that of Zelda. You also get upgrades as you progress through the game to both your combat abilities and your "Glove" abilities which are mostly used for enviornmental puzzles, but can ALSO be used in combat. This is a pretty great system and I love it. 

There are places and area (specifically in the beginning) where you might not have the ability or upgrade needed to get to or unlock a certain area. This is where the metroidvania style comes into play. These are almost all (atleast so far for me) optional upgrade items, like a heart piece, or a mana brick, but useful none the less for those of us willing to take the time to back track and find them. 

The story telling is almost purely through the enviornment, and this is where the Journey feel comes from. There is no dialogue, which might sound like a negative, but I really dig it. I'm not sure exactly why I'm doing what the characters are doing, but I do know I'm having fun doing it, and I can see things in the enviornment that seem like subtle clues as to whats happening in this world. Speaking if which I LOVE the art design and direction. The Music is also top notch as well, really setting the mood and tone. 

This game has barebones requirements to run on your PC and for only $20 I simply CANNOT recommend this game enough. I should note, I am only 2 and a half hours or so into the game but man I am really digging this game. Two thumbs up.

35240088.review:
对于这款游戏！我是非常的喜欢的！所以说一下以下几点：
1、游戏的画面棒的不行，在宣传片里想必就能看到一二，本人是学游戏动画的，高考学的也是艺术，对该游戏的画面我只想说，非常棒，不论从什么角度来看。
2、游戏的解密性也很强，怎么说呢，这个东西需要大家自己去感受，我就不多说了，总之在我看来这款游戏的解密很棒，我玩过不少此类型的解密（ps：不是那种密室解密）就解密来说不敢说最好，但绝对是上乘（ps：有人说解密难，没有提示，我只想说，你带脑子来玩就不难了，给你提示了还叫解迷吗？那叫散步，真正得解密游戏给你那么多提示反而会降低游戏性，而且提示他有，只是没有写出来，画面的前后关系都是解密的细节要素，所以说玩游戏要带脑子。至于那些说迷路的，地图就那么大你都能迷路，是真的路痴啊！反正我玩时都是一遍过，不存在什么迷路？这游戏本来分支就少，有也不长，怎么会迷路我都想不通）
3、动作戏上我就不多说了，打击感还行，没差。无cd翻滚很好的帮你打怪，但不代表着就很简单，你可以试试非常困难，反正我是没试过。
4、Bug目前为止我没有遇到过一个bug，讲道理我不知道别人那么多bug哪来的，我玩着都好好的所以我也不多说。但是闪退和卡顿这种东西总不能怪人家游戏吧，这种东西的解决方案网上和测评应该都有，我玩过大大小小这么游戏，卡顿闪退都发生在一个时间段，就是我还在用垃圾笔记本时的阶段，自从换了台式机之后从来玩游戏不存在闪退这种东西。所以说！骚年，想好好玩游戏吗！玩个电脑吧！没钱？那就只能在其他方面下手了，所以这种事情就不要怪人家游戏公司了。（如果你的电脑吊的一笔还是有那么多问题的话，我只想说！兄弟去买彩票吧！拿奖了给我一点花花就好）
5、很多人吐槽这款游戏对键盘玩家很不友好！嗯！的确！人家官方都发现了有这个问题，所以再买游戏的商店界面我记得强调了那么一句话（注意: 请注意：强烈建议使用控制器进行游戏。）官方都这么提醒了，还加了“强烈”两个字，你还不懂吗？讲句公道话，我是很喜欢玩游戏的，所以我也知道，想要好好玩这类游戏，一个手柄是必不可少的。而那些不怎么玩游戏的人也就图个乐呵，就不要太在意这些了啦！
总的来说，这些大部分游戏本来设计时就不是为pc端制作的，强行转到PC端肯定会有很多问题，真正爱玩游戏的人会入手ps、xbox之类的游戏机，那些不怎么玩或没钱买的那就只能委屈一下了，毕竟没钱就要认怂的嘛！（电脑还是贷款买的，就为了能好好玩个游戏）
我就是来安利一下这款游戏的，相信真正爱玩游戏且已经玩过了的兄弟们会和我有同样的感受，希望你们有个好的游戏选择（由于本人喜爱这款游戏，所以言论中会有很多偏袒成分，望谅解，毕竟人是有感情的生物嘛！）

35239793.review:
For the Adventure, Action and Puzzle aspects, Hob is a well done one. Beautiful art style plus atmospheric soundtracks add a lot of positive points to my thinking about this game. The puzzles are not so so enough to make you feel bored through your first 2 hours of playing. The combat is pretty great, you got slash and dodge at the beginning and would get more various techniques throughout the story. Personally, I quite enjoyed playing this game till the very end.

The problem is, Hob doesn't have much explanations about the basic things in game. Maybe you will wonder a lot at the beginning about how everything works because there won't be any conversation explaining what you need to do. 

Another concern is the control part. ugh.. I don't say this game has a terrible controller support. It works perfectly but the moves are not quite right for me. For example, you can't control the direction while in the air, it's just a straight way jump and I really feel uncomfortable with it. I mean, oh come on 3D moves without 3D jump eh? For me it's a big problem because you can't enjoy the game fully if you're uncomfortable with the control right?

For the summary, I will rate this 8/10

If you go for the Adventure-Puzzle part, I absolutely recommend you to buy this game but for the platforming, it's such a let down.

35239725.review:
Hob is a must play game. It's a well crafted masterpiece in my opinion that needs your attention. Even if platforming and solving puzzles isn't your thing, the game is also an exploration-heavy action adventure, you will not be disappointed, you will love this.

Story:
You arrive in a new land, nobody there speaks your language, there is no text to help you, you don't know what you have to do but there seems to be a friendly robot that cares to guide you but never holds your hand,  you must figure things out by yourself. The lore of the game will "blow your mind" if you can find all the clues and once again i'll say that the game has zero text or speach that will tell you the lore, the way they tell you the story is brilliant.

Gameplay:
You solve puzzles, you complete challenging platforming levels you fight various of enemies and you collect stuff you find along the way to upgrade your character. Everything is requiring exloring and if you do it right you will find some very well hiden secrets. There is a rewarding feeling when you figure those puzzles out, and when you finally complete a cave/dungeon or kill a badas enemy with your minimal gear. The level design is perfect, i can't remember an other game with such a perfect level design.

Visuals:
This is a goreous game, everything is beautiful and very carefully placed in the world. There are some spots on the map that you will stop just to take some screenshots and admire the scenery or look for places you haven't been, even in lower end pc's the scenery and the backgrounds are beautiful.

Audio/Music:
Nobody speaks your language, but you can understand what the locals want to say to you, the music is very relaxing and the ambiance sounds help you to understand your surroundings.

Duration:
The game is "short", about 10-20 hours to reach the end, it took me 25-30 to uncover everything on the map. I don't say its not value for money, this game has so much to give to you. Nevertheless i wanted more of it, really badly. This game should be a series one day and Runic showed us in the past that they can do it. 

Backtracking:
I was a bit confused in the beginning i had no idea what i was collecing or where i should go next. Later on i got used to it, everything made sense and i knew what i was looking for in each new area. I can see people getting lost for their first 20ish-30 minutes and backtrack a lot until they find out how to progress from the first areas but it's something that makes sense a bit later. Minor-spoiler if you are backtracking or lost: You can fast traver and look at your map!

Synopsis:
They worked really hard on this game and it something you can tell just from the first couple of minutes playing it or just watching a trailer. It's a game you must play by yourself and don't get spoiled by videos or streams, it's a game you must take your time to admire and don't rush to see the ending. The progression, the character upgrates, the new stuff they planned for each new area that the player was supposed to be, they crafted this game with love and passion. New mechanics, new jumps, new puzzles, new secrets, new everything in every corner. I loved the part that you could stop in most places to admire the scenery and to look for new places you haven't been and maybe take one screenshot or ten. I loved fighing bosses especially when i speedruned it with the bare essential gear as one of the achievements suggests. And i loved spending some time to understand the lore after i finished my first run and had no clue what happend. 

Now it's your chance, make it home.

35239363.review:
Runic Games kommt nach einigen Jahren endlich mit einem neuen Spiel. Diesmal leider kein neues Torchlight dafür aber ein hervorragendes Action Adventure. Hob schafft von Anfang an eine hervorragende Atmosphäre die einen in seinen Bann zieht. Das Gameplay läuft hervorragend rund und der Soundtrack plätschert atmosphärisch im Hintergrund. Die Story wird ohne Worte erzählt was bisher erstaunlich gut funktioniert. Im Gegensatz zu einem Zelda scheint in diesem Spiel der Fokus mehr auf Rätseln als auf dem Kampf zu liegen. Was nicht heißt das der Kampf nicht wichtig ist!
Das Spiel ist ein muss für jeden Fan der klassischen Zelda Teile der eine gute Atmosphäre zu schätzen weiß!

35238982.review:
因为看到是Runic Games出的游戏 不觉产生了好感
觉得在质量方面肯定是有保证的  所以就预购了一哈 盼星星盼月亮一样终于等到了发售
迫不及待的下载下来玩了一下 以下是已经玩了将近三个小时的感受 
战斗：
首先在战斗方面 感觉操作相当的流畅 刨去本身应该就这么流畅来说 这甚至可以是加分项了
而且在面对新的怪物的时候并没有提示战斗方式 需要自己探索战斗技巧 这点在我看来感觉很真实
不过因为是刚刚发售的游戏 战斗中也是存在BUG的 就我遇到的BUG而言就是把怪物卡在墙角打的时候 怪物是锁血的 打不死 需要用拳击倒后才能杀掉 不知道是不是也是隐藏要素 233

解谜：
解谜这个要素可以说是这个游戏的主要成分了 战斗在我看来只是辅助要素
Hob整体的解谜难度就我而言是中等偏难的 [spoiler]主要是我智商比较低[/spoiler]
和大部分的解谜游戏一样 卡关都是令人抓狂的 但是在Hob中揭秘思路是有迹可循的
密匙在上一步的操作中均有出现 有卡关的朋友可以回头重推一步两步 应该就可以完美解决了 
目前在解谜上的BUG我还没有遇到  以后遇到了有缘再补充[spoiler]要是把我卡死了 我就弃坑了[/spoiler]

操作：
之所以把战斗和操作分离来说 是因为我觉得Hob虽然战斗做的很流畅 但是移动跳跃等操作确实十分中庸
看到之前评论里有朋友是PC端的键鼠操作 反馈是不太好使 
我是使用手柄的 在Hob中的视角锁定和变换让我感觉有些僵硬 [spoiler]卡视角也可以说是解谜的要素了 不过我就是不爽[/spoiler]
[spoiler]再加上之前在玩Tokyo42 转视角转的太爽了[/spoiler]
然后这个僵硬的视角让我好几次跳的时候直接坠崖 
可以说是吐槽了

其他BUG：
有一次坠崖死掉了 直接让我回到梦开始的地方 还好当时游戏进程不够远
不然我感觉我要暴走了

总体 ：
Hob总体来说是十分不错的
虽然部分存在BUG  但是无论是画风 BGM 还是战斗风格都很让我沉迷
[spoiler]希望凭我的智力能走到最后 感谢制作组[/spoiler]
推荐！ 8/10

通关了之后我的剑才升级了一次 回去找碎片已经找不到了 我要死了 看来要二周目了

35237340.review:
玩了一个小时，说说自己的感受。
游戏视角对我来说还好，没有特别不适应，但是战斗系统对我来说稍微有点不太好，动作略略略略显僵硬，可能是我还没有升级更强的格斗技能，不知道升级后会不会好一些。
解密内容还不错，我玩了一个小时来说暂时没有遇到什么很难得解密，而且画风很清新感觉还不错。
然后就是这个游戏最大的特色（大概）没有对话！没有任务！没有指引！
对话其实是有的，但是没有人可以听懂（NPC会叽里呱啦挂啦激励）任务是真的没有，NPC就为你指个路你就一直往前跑去了，然后他给你一张地图之后你就可以大概知道自己在什么地方。
战斗来说相对简单，黑魂玩家的话战斗就是小菜一碟了（滑稽），当然有时候你可以选择打怪或者不打怪直接跑路，我是打了怪再走的，打怪不难就是动作看起来不是很舒服。
总体来说，这款游戏我给中上的评价，刚开始玩的话会给玩家一种迷茫的感觉，再玩一玩因为没有任务没有剧情（应该是再往后打要自己理解）玩家就可能会觉得枯燥。但是画风真的还不错，今天晚上回来再玩玩看什么体验。

75/100分

一、关于卡顿、动画慢（参考宣传视频实际有多快）：
1.游戏默认集成显卡，需要在NVIDA控制面板里手动改：纹理过滤-质量，改成高性能即可(本人显卡GTX660)
2.未使用连接到NVIDIA GPU 的显示器怎么办？台式机后面的显示器连线换个位置插，需要直连显卡才会起作用（台式机后面一般有两个可插，自己核对显示器上的接口，应该不难找）
二、关于游戏：
1.开局跟着机器人走即可，跟丢了重生吧
三、关于操作：
1.基本操作看帮助
2.学会猛击后有两点说明：攻击地面需要先起跳，打残墙需要蓄力
3.趴在藤蔓梯子上是可以横向跳跃的

先到这里吧，知道以上问题基本可以渡过新手期了

35236560.review:
I'm enjoying the game immensely.  The art style is gorgeous and the world is vast and breathtaking.  Exploration has been fun so far; The game has a distinctly metroidvania feel to it, featuring unique and interesting environmental interactions with various character abilities.  Both movement and combat are suprisingly crisp, fluid and responsive with no animation locks. Even the music that I've heard so far is atmospheric and resonant without being intrusive.

The game's outstanding issue so far is odd inexplicable FPS drops and slowdowns. With a system that tremendously exceeds recommended specs the game drops as low as 20 FPS at times.  So far I've tested in 1920x1080, 2560x1440 and 3840x2160 with a variety of settings and the same results.  I haven't ruled out the possibility of some issue on my end however, and will continue to experiment.

I've had a great deal of fun with the game so far and hope that sooner rather than later the performance issues will be ironed out.

[b][i][u]EDIT 9/28/17:[/u][/i][/b] Turning off Vsync in the Nvidia control panel and playing with only the game's Vsync yielded some favorable results.  There are still massive framerate drops, but even the worst drops are well above my monitor's 60mhz refresh rate.  It'a a band-aid solution at best.

[b][i][u]EDIT 9/29/17:[/u][/i][/b] Finished the game and admittedly my response soured somewhat towards the end.  Hob does a lot of things right, but there are some missed opportunities for really spectacular gameplay.

The complete lack of boss fights is puzzling as the crisp, fluid combat quickly becomes unnecessary and inconsequential.  I kept getting cool abilities and upgrades, then just running past enemies because [i]not[/i] fighting was faster and more efficient.

The game seems aggressively underexplained; Even at the final cutscene you're given nothing more than characters pantomiming while speaking unintelligible gibberish.  There are locations where the lore of the game is supposedly revealed, but they're optional so the player can skip them either intentionally or accidentally.  In addition, the lore locations all seem to show obscure symbols and lights devoid of context.  I'm still not entirely sure just what happened in this game.

The worst issue is the camera and the player's inability to adjust it.  The only zoom and rotation are controlled by the game itself at specific points; The game shows the player what it [i][u]thinks[/u][/i] is relevant at the time.  This can highlight important changes in the ever-shifting world, but just as often it leads to frustration when you can't even get a good look in the direction of your objective or line up a jump comfortably.  Lack of depth perception will become an issue eventually, as well as the necessity of making blind jumps towards the screen.

Even with these issues however, the game is definitely worth a play just for the experience, although it's probably best to wait for a sale.

Its very immersive and does not hold your hand when it comes to the puzzles, which is a very welcome change. If you like any of the Legend of Zelda games, you should give this a try. Recommended!

35236183.review:
tl;dr - Buy it.

Hob is completely different than Torchlight or TL2.  It's not an ARPG really at all.  I'd say it's more akin to a platforming-based Zelda.  Yes there is a little combat, sword attacks, dodge roll mechanics, the equivalent of hearts that you build up, etc.  But mostly its about finding the way through the levels with the gradually acquired new gloves and abilities you get.  There's blessedly no dialogue.  The game nudges you forwards with new skills and equipment that you need to get further and Runic has done a great job not giving you too many at once.

I was wondering if I'd like a Runic game that wasn't diablo-esque and the answer for me is a resounding yes.

35235973.review:
So far a good game, with one big BUT.

When I first played the game, I had several crashes within the first 15 minutes. I went back to the launcher options and saw that "Controller Vibration" was enabled. Well, my controllers do not have force feedback, so I tried disabling that feature. Voila! No more crashes (knock on wood). So it seems that either using "controller vibration" causes crashes or using "controller vibration" on a controller without that feature causes crashes.

Other than that, I have enjoyed the game. The puzzles can be tricky, so be patient and EXPLORE.

35235838.review:
Likes:
Beautiful art style. Fun combat; dodge, roll, block, leap, slash, dash and punch enemies to make them explode into bloody bits. Puzzle solving. Open world. Skill and component upgrades were a nice surpise. 

Dislikes:
Puzzles aren't very complicated. Camera position can make some areas awkward to navigate.

Thoughts:
I spent the first 20-30 minutes very cautious and couldn't figure out how to progress beyond the starting zone, then it happened by accident. A little direction may have helped, but I understand that they wanted to do the story without words, so I suppose it was like another puzzle to solve. While the puzzles aren't very complicated I do enjoy figuring them out. The combat is also enjoyable with different methods required for fighting different enemies. Some enemies will one shot you. I have died many, many times playing the game on Medium difficulty. Most deaths are a result of falling off narrow bridges, missing jumps, or due to some other environmental hazard though. Overall I am enjoying the game and am surprised to only have earned 14% of achievements after 5 hours of gameplay. I did not expect the game to be much longer than that for a single play through. I'm curious to see if there is any replayability or if it's a one and done game. For $20, I definitely recommend.

35235374.review:
Very fun old school Zelda-esque game. The character upgrades and skills are nice. The Controls feel good for the most part. The aesthetics are neat but it's not for everyone.

The main downside with gameplay can be some performance issues in areas where a lot of stuff is going on as you run through. Hopefully Runic will fix that with patches. The camera is fixed and transitions awkardly at times. I did die a couple times when running and jumping through sections I'd already cleared only to have the camera mess with my movement and make my jump lead me off a cliff.

The biggest downside to me personally is that there is literally one boss fight (which is optional). Sure there are some stronger enemies here and there, but none of them are required to defeat to progress. It really took away from the game from me because that was one of my favorite parts of those types of games.

For others the lack of a storyline or clear character motivations will hurt your experience. If you look past that and just want to focus on the gameplay you'll be fine, but it's definitely something they could have improved upon.

I would still recommend the game but it's probably something that is better to get on sale. The game is fun. It just has some issues that make it something a bit more niche. Which, if you found this to begin with might be what you're looking for.

Je recommanderai ce jeu a n'importe qui, qui aime ce style de jeu ! (Zelda) J'ai appris que le studio ayant fait ce jeu a été fermé et je trouve cela extrêmement dommage. 35235128.review:
//=========17.11.23更新
才知道工作组做完这个游戏解散了，莫名感到伤感。
其实这游戏最大的问题就是出现的太晚了，在荒野之息出现的今年，只能感叹生不逢时，唉！

//========以下为原答案
凌晨熬夜下好后完了30min，发现帧数超级低，以为是优化问题，没了兴致，便睡了，但今天刚上steam，发现它有了一个更新，以为是优化补丁，但还是巨卡，都要放弃它后，发现有大佬说是默认集显启动，更换后，嗯，如牛奶般丝滑的体验。
游戏本身素质过的去，可以算的上是精致小品。
###9.28 补充
昨天花了一天时间，将主线通关。先说总体评价，它给我的感觉和ori and blind forest很想，都是通过简单的几种解密要素、加上本身绝妙的地图设计支撑起了整个地图探索的乐趣所在，它们的战斗系统虽然设计的比较完善，但除了在几个比较重要场景外，其余地图上都只是点缀，你完全可以跑酷来避开他们。下面从一些几点详细评价：
- 地图设计
- 战斗系统
- 角色养成系统
- 剧情
- 不足

###地图设计
可以说这个游戏的地图设计是十分精美的，在游戏的大后期，你可以发现游戏中比较重要的场景都是相互连通的，同时制作组为了减少玩家第二次跑图的痛苦，在跑酷的关卡中设立了许多快捷通道，其中不乏有起点直通终点的通道，故本质上，在游戏中，你通常只需要完成一次艰难的跑图过程。妈妈再也不用担心我在已通关的道路中又死了一万次。（没错，说的就是你，ori）。游戏过程中，整个游戏世界会有两次大的改变，（回复电力，回复水源），这时，你之前探索的地图中不可用的机关（回复电力后）、不可到达的区域（回复水源）都会变得可使用（到达），故很多时候，第二次跑图的体验还是比较愉悦的。但同时由于整个地图的结构是随着游戏进程变化的，有些你花了大量精力和时间才通过的机关在地图变化后，往往会变成平地或短短几个台阶，这使得有些精妙的机关无法在一周目的情况下二次体验...

###战斗系统
游戏本身的战斗系统是小而精致的，你拥有奔跑，跳跃，翻滚，闪烁，持盾等基本动作模块，而且动作都十分流畅。但在实际通关过程中，你会发现往往不需要这些多余操作，因为这游戏为了简化做出了三个十分BT的设定：1.持盾受到攻击时只损失能量，能量不足时破盾不掉血。2.怪物攻击持盾状态时，百分百被打断连招. 3.翻滚的无敌帧巨长，判定区域巨大，几乎你只要在怪物的抬手的时候翻滚，一般都不会受伤。1和2的设定衍生了一个巨无耻的打法，持盾反击流，而且由于游戏中击退距离一般都很短，这使得这种流派几乎适应与任何场合的任何怪物，甚至有时候由于战斗场景十分狭小，这流派几乎成了当时的唯一解。持盾反击的唯一缺点就是输出太低，往往你都是慢慢磨死一个怪物，如果你感到厌烦而此时战斗区域足够大，你便可以亮出你的大刀，冲到怪物群中做真真的太阳骑士，因为由于3设定的存在，你有时在怪物脸上翻滚都是无敌的。
###角色养成系统
角色的能力分为基础和强化，基础中分为拳套、剑、披风，其中拳套的能力是随着剧情推进而解锁的，剑的能力很单一，只是单纯的收集铁块来提高伤害，而披风则需要你自己找到图纸，并花费点数来解锁，披风提供的一般是一种光环能力。强化（除了最开始的几个）则都需要你首先获得图纸，并通过点数来解锁。这种系统本身自由性不高，而且升级能力几乎都只对战斗有用，故如果你对自己操作自信，完全可以放弃这一部分（好像有个奖杯就是这样）

###剧情or攻略（剧透预警）
纵观现在所有的不推荐评价，几乎所有的都在吐槽这个，完全没有任何提示，一出生时候，除了知道跟随一个机器人跑，完全不知道该干什么。整个序章除了知道得到失去手臂->得到机械拳套和剑后完全不知道任何其他事。故当序章结束后，当机械爷爷给我指了地图上一个小点时，我是懵逼的，由于不知道其实要绕路，我在那个平台上光跳崖都不下10次，整个卡关持续了1h，要不是当时抱着“使用拳套能力去开之前的近路”的想法向地图左边跑并惊讶的发现了新探索区域，并意外发现这个新的区域尽然可以达到目的时，我想我可能放弃了这个游戏。但实际现在会过头来，其实这都是被“开放世界”这个词害的，本质上，这算不得一个开放世界，由于角色的能力是按主线来解锁的，而很多地方你没新能力根本没法去，故本游戏本质上是一个“伪线性游戏”。想到这里，也就突然明白为什么制作组敢设立这样毫无提示的序章，因为你没地方跑啊。故这个游戏你可能会卡关，但绝对不会死档。因为卡关的时候唯一可去的地方一定就是目的地，无论它在地图上离目的地有多远。但不得不吐槽的是，这个想法并不是一个刚入游戏的新人所想到的，尤其是作为游戏刚发售时的新人，于是不得不提一句，序章之后的1h内，这游戏带给人的是煎熬而并非享受。现在，说一说老玩家的心得。这游戏的主线如介绍一样，是修复一个岛屿，具体上就是将高低起伏、支离破碎的土地通过机关一步步连接起来。在具体一点，就是修复电力->修复水源->唤醒泰坦（为了连接到一个浮空岛屿）。那么如何去做了，首先，游戏本身是有提示的，就是前往地图上圆圈十字标志所表示的地方去打开机关，有些机关本身会没有能源，故此时你需要去一些机关去去一个蓝色发光的玻璃罐或一些能量块，需要注意的是这些东西一般都在附近。有时，你会遇见紫色的植物（？）作为障碍，有些你需要绕过，有些完全没法绕过时，你就要想办法去地图上一个特殊的标志所对应的地方去干掉它们的boss(这是不需要战斗的，相反，你需要首先就一个被困的精灵，然后走剧情就可以了)，boss一共有7个，相对应被困精灵也有7个，印象中，boss和精灵一般都在一起，游戏后期boss和精灵可能会分别在两个岔路上，需要注意的一定要先救精灵，故推荐先用一条命去探路，确定精灵所在在规划下一步。7个boss分布在地图各个部分，有些你在“恢复电力”、“修复水源”的是否是没必要去杀的。但7个boss的完成后，你会会获得一个圆珠子（母亲的赠礼），这玩意儿和你额外收集的另外2个是唤醒泰坦的重要物品，故本质上7个boss也是必须打的，怎么规划路线就全凭个人喜好的。虽然没有任务提示，但只要跟着地图上的目的地标志（圆环十字）走，一般都不会开关。附带提一句，要注意地图上会有一些“破旧”的树，这是可以被打破的，同时一般它也会指明前进方向或者收集品方向。再附带一句，地图上的怪你只要不刷新地图，你打死一只就少一只，故很多时候，你可以用命去填平道路。再再附带一句，前期最好将剑升到2级，我当初只没注意，后来打一些必须的怪的时候发现伤害严重不足。

###缺点
前面都在说优点，但缺点仍就存在：
1. 对键鼠及其不友好，由于探索大多在狭窄地区，很多地形走向和跳跃方向本身并非“正直”，这对最多只有8方向的键盘实在是难以完成，尤其在游戏中一些限时的机关中，这种痛苦成指数增长。
2. 音乐：画面如此优良，音乐却很平平淡淡，难道开发商将资金投入了“20国语言支持”中了吗（手动滑稽）。

35234346.review:
Mi primer vistazo de Hob en video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F9BOIYg9dAk

Bellísimo juego de puzzles, plataformas y acción, con muy lindos gráficos y un apartado sonoro para disfrutar.

La premisa es evolucionar. A medida que vamos progresando con mejoras y nuevas habilidades, todo esto nos permitirá acceder a zonas del mapa hasta ese momento imposibles de entrar, superar nuevos obstaculos y realizar mejores ataques para poder enfrentar enemigos más ásperos.

El juego es un mundo abierto, y está lleno de secretos, por lo que la exploración es fundamental (y muy divertida).

Toda la historia se nos va a contar sin palabras, con las escenas cinemáticas de la intro y las actuadas durante el juego, parece interesante pero al momento lo que encuentro más divertido es explorar el expansivo mundo de Hob.

En resumen, cuando vi los screens pensé que no me iba a gustar tanto como finalmente sucedió, lo recomiendo totalmente si te van juegos como por ejemplo el clásico "Ico".

35232585.review:
FANTASTIC experience so far!

With only a couple of hours in so far, I normally wait on reviewing a game. I have to though for HOB because it deserves to be recommended. If you enjoy puzzle/platforming adventures with a little combat then here is your new addiction.

PROS:

Wonderful graphics that fit the enviroments and characters well.
Responsive controls (using 360 controller)
Camera is spot on with movement (which is a huge deal for me)
Exploring is rewarded
Combat is smooth and fluent
Runs well on my aging gaming laptop.
Save points are often enough to keep from having to replay areas to much

CONS: 

Had it freeze one time which caused a reboot, but save was ok
So far enemies are not to difficult (could change deeper in)

I highly recommend HOB if you have any intrest in buying. Looking forward to more and hope RUNIC might down the road throw some DLC at us.

35231071.review:
h1] 一场震撼人心的旅程 [/h1]

通关之后的测评

这游戏讲述的是一位麒麟臂少年拯救星球的故事 随着探索的进行 玩家会不断遇到新的谜题 解开各种谜题的同时 星球上的大地会随之变化 然后你就会领略到~~ 这地图是真TM的大

先说下解密方面 我玩到现在基本没遇到过卡关的情况 谜题都还可以 有一定的挑战 但是不难 只要仔细一点都能解开
 
然后是战斗方面 说实话 要是说这个游戏的缺点的话 我觉得就是这个战斗系统稍稍差了点 首先手感并不是那么的理想 有时候打怪会遇到穿模型的现象 其次 至今为止遇到的小怪都太弱了 有点体会不到战斗的乐趣... 好了 战斗难度已经提升了 虽然怪还是那些怪 但是奈何他们各个一身神装...

然后是地图 这个游戏是有鸟瞰点这个设定的每次站在鸟瞰点上看地图的时候 我都想感慨一句 [spoiler]地图真的大[/spoiler]
游戏的隐藏要素很多 很多地方需要你拿到新能力后才能打开  所以前面遇到进不去的地方稍稍记一下 以免后面忘记 星球内部的图 每张图有4个东西要收集 这个要仔细找才能找到
每次解开新的场景那个画面真的是很震撼 真的推荐大家去亲身尝试下

说下结局 应该是有三种结局  
1杀掉女皇完成清理    2接受女皇的存在 星球依然被污染   3升级完剑 进入四个留有信息的房间 应该能不杀掉女王又能清除污染 算是圆满结局 

ps:其实我玩这游戏大部分时间都在砍草 这游戏砍草砍的特别舒服 真是享受

적들이 5~6종류에 여기서 방어구나 무기만 바꾸고 나와서 좀 아쉽더군요.

첫날에는 버그 대폭발하면서 30분마다 한번씩 튕겼는데

괜찮은 게임으로 기억에 남을 것 같습니다.

35230610.review:
优点：优秀的美术风格，优秀的配乐，优秀的战斗手感，优秀的节奏感，以及抽离语言后依然优秀的设计
魔幻+蒸汽朋克的美术风格别具一格，又不会彼此突兀
观景台+轻快交响乐的设计非常在一通解谜和战斗后又给了玩家悠闲的放松空间
爽快的战斗手感让人很难想象这不是一款ACT游戏
解谜、战斗、放松三者的比重相得益彰
通过巨人和主人公的简单肢体语言，以及环境的诱导，在没有语音、对话文本的情况下，依然能够诱使玩家顺利游戏

缺点：稍显重复的解谜和略带敷衍的隐藏收集要素，还有对PC不友好的手感，并不稳定的运行质量
也许是因为诱使工作太过出色，加上解谜部分的要素较少，所以解谜的部分虽然一开始可以让人眼前一亮，但2小时候略显重复的解谜就变得如功课般索然无味
因为隐藏要素都涉及到装备升级，也许是不想对轻度玩家太不友好，这些“隐藏”简直可以用敷衍形容，大大降低了收集癖发现新大陆时的快感
PC端在快速移动时，操纵移动方向的手感并不友好，即便将冲刺改建到鼠标上，要流畅舒适的进行移动键盘上依然需要最少3根手指。当然，在商店页面当众runic已经诚恳的做出了建议——使用手柄
最后是运行质量，不知道是不是因为初期优化有所欠缺，游戏的运行质量非常不稳定，时而可以在最高画质下轻松稳定60帧，时而用低画质也很难维持在24帧以上，这可能是目前为止最大的扣分项

总的来说，如果满分十分，我至少会给HOB八分的成绩。这是一部让我充满惊喜的作品，熬夜第一时间下载第一时间游玩物有所值，相信不会有那么多无脑的声音大喊“我们不要HOB，我们要TL3了”

35229742.review:
Никаких квестов. Минимум интерфейса. Приоткрытый мир. Паркур на грани фолла. Медитативная музыка. Просто чинишь мир и умираешь. Прокачиваешь навыки, оружие и умираешь. 35228833.review:
As of the launch-day version, the game has crashed and I've locked myself into a room I can't escape due to a bug, losing, as far as I can tell, the entire save file.

I spent most of my time running around aimlessly in circles for an hour because the abilities weren't automatically bound to my Xbox 360 controller, so I didn't realize I had them. Then, later, some abilities wouldn't bind at all--or I just didn't receive them, whichever the case, and I couldn't find a way to change the bindings.

When things WERE actually working as intended, which was about 50% of the time, I found myself enjoying it, even though it was all sort of aimless guesswork and wandering without much in the way of clues or context. 

My problems with the things that function as intended (to say nothing of the bugs) are mostly as follows:

- You can't change your trajectory mid-jump, which is a really lousy feature of realism to add to a fantasy/steampunk platformer
- The abstractness of your non-objective combined with all the dead ends you can wander into occasionally made me wonder what I was doing with my time 
- Auto-death from jumping off a not-that-high ledge is also a bad feature in a platformer

Somehow, despite all this, I was charmed enough by the world and found the combat elements fun enough that I still recommend trying it. Just, maybe wait a little bit for them to smooth out all the bumps.

EDIT: After another playthrough, I reached the same spot and was still unable to progress to due to an errot where my character simply wasn't receiving the requisite ability. Lost over an hour to each attempt. Am giving up on the game for now, unfortunately, until it's fixed.

35228698.review:
Hob is a beautiful, expansive journey through a world literally torn apart by war. The remnants of a long lost world are scattered across lush green forests, and dusty brown deserts. Ancient temples and copper pipes protrude from the natural canopy that has covered up the secrets of the past. Discovering these secrets is what drives you forward in Hob, and it makes the game an ever evolving mystery right up until its final moments.


With no exposition, Hob’s main menu fades into the first moments of gameplay. You are freed from a tomb by a hulking mechanical automaton. You’re not told to follow it, but you know it is what you’re supposed to do. These moments teach you that this robot is your guide, and friend. Your new friend’s will becomes clear over time: It wants you to restore the world to its former glory and destroy the blight poisoning the land.


Throughout your journey you will literally rebuild the world by repairing the ancient machines that rest just below the surface. These serve as the game’s dungeons, and upon completing them you are rewarded by watching the world literally rise up from the abyss. Every time I saw the intricate puzzle pieces shift and move into place I was amazed. Hob has a stunning art style, but the ever changing level design is what really steals the show.


You’ll also come across upgrades in these dungeons. Chief among them are Armaments that enhance the giant robotic hand your character has. These Armaments upgrade your traversal abilities allowing you to access previously inaccessible locations. In addition to Armaments you will also find health and energy upgrades, as well as schematics that allow you upgrade your combat abilities.


The combat is a bit of a mixed bag. You have a sword and the previously mentioned hand to attack with. You also have a simple dodge that provides a few frames of invincibility, and you can unlock the ability to block with a shield. When the encounters work as intended, the combat can be fun and challenging, but it does get repetitive over time. The real issue that I ran into where enemies that would get stuck on the game’s geometry or lose aggro for no reason. These glitches totally broke the flow of the combat encounters when they arose. They sometimes led to untimely deaths that felt out of my control. Thankfully, the game uses an in-world resurrection system similar to the Vita Chambers in BioShock, so you rarely lose progress when dying.


There’s a big world hiding just below the surface.
Hob features a fixed isometric camera that locks your field of view. The camera only moves when the game wants you to pay attention to something. It will drop down to a more conventional 3rd person view at key parts of the story to provide you with a grand view of the adventures ahead. Other times it will shift just enough to give you a peak at an area you cannot access yet, showing you a secret you may want to investigate later. Generally, the camera serves the game’s style well, but can sometimes be a nuisance during later platforming segments. The camera can sometimes make it difficult to judge depth and this can cause jumps to miss their mark. In addition, I ran into a few instances where I clipped through the ground when performing a jump. These moments were rare, but frustrating.


You must solve puzzles to reactivate the mechanisms that bring life back to the world. The tools you use to solve the puzzles are fairly traditional; you have to move blocks around or reach certain destinations in a short amount of time. While the tools are ordinary, the solutions are not. Just like the story, you have to pick up on context clues to understand what the game is asking of you. Many of the puzzles are seamlessly integrated into the natural flow of the game, and you may not even realize you’re solving one until you complete it.


The inevitable conclusion here is that Hob is a masterwork of exploration and puzzle solving. All of the game’s aspects come together to form a cohesive whole that is both entertaining and awe inspiring from start to finish. There may be a few hiccups along the way, but they’re easily overlooked when compared to the nearly flawless execution of the rest of the game. Hob is an adventure that will keep you enthralled right up until the very end, and even then you may not be ready for what it has in store.

35228526.review:
Initial impressions after a couple hours:

I came in to this game with zero knowledge of what the game was about - other than the guys that made Torchlight made this.

The world of Hob is very mysterious, there isnt any spoken word or written dialogue in the game.  The game has many callbacks to the classic Zelda feel. You are plopped down on unfamiliar territory and you are to use your wits to unravel the world around you.  There are two main weapons in the game, your glove, and your sword. Both of which seem like they have upgrade paths - but only after you have found fragment pieces of each of them to upgrade.

I have been to what feels like 3-4 mini dungeons, in these they give you an upgrade for your glove ala the items you find in dungeons in classic Zelda. These glove upgrades are much like the Zelda items where it is used to help solve the upcoming puzzels,  not only that, but they are used in unlocking areas in the outside world as well.

I love classic Zelda, and sometimes I wonder why there aren't more games like it in the genre.  The only time where I am frustrated at times is when I am lost at what to do next. Since there is no dialogue or voice acting, you are encouraged to explore every nook and cranny of the world.

There were times where I felt like I stumbled upon a place way too high for my charachters skill level - where enemies were taking my whole life bar away in one swing - it is moments like this that provide a sense of wonder in the world of HoB and I can't wait to see what I uncover next.

One of the minor gripes I have so far is that there is no motivation for the charachter to traverse this world. Why were you plopped on this piece of land, so what if you collect sword and glove upgrades? What does that entitle? Why are you doing these things,  is there a greater evil, are you trying to save the world from the monsters that roam the land? Motive of why you are doing the things you do is unclear at the moment; hopefully that clears up as I progress through the game.

That notion however is a double edge sword - it just makes me want to continue digging deeper in the world of Hob.

35228071.review:
This has been revised as my experience has grown.  Overall, I would still recommend HoB, but here are my thoughts on some of the more talked about features.

First, the game world.  The game world of HoB is pretty exquisite.  The art style, creatures, and sense of grandeur are extremely well done.  Watching the world change, based on your in game actions, is really neat and satisfying.  The way the different pieces of the puzzle-like world fit together and change over time is seamless and I'm pretty blown away.  I actually cannot imagine trying to make something like this work.  In my eyes, it's quite an achievement.

Second, the story or lack of one.  For me, this isn't an issue.  I'm actually having a great time with the mystery of the world.  I feel like the character, I'm just trying to figure out what the hell is going on while piecing things together through the puzzles.  It's pretty refreshing especially since I'm a bit of a snob about writing.  I'm not done with the game so I don't know how it unfolds, but right now (4-5 hours played) it is not an issue.  In fact, I think it works incredibly well because of the World's mysterious atmosphere.  That said, a lot of others have expressed frustration about this.  Their sentiments have been akin to, "I'm doing this just because."  To those people I say, "use your fucking imagination."

Third, the combat.  Combat is pretty similar to Zelda (much of this game is similar to Zelda).  You swing your sword and punch your way to victory.  Some mobs die in a couple hits, others take quite awhile to kill.  Some aren't very dangerous, others kill you in 1 hit if you incorrectly time a dodge.  The progression of your sword skills/glove skills are noticeable.  Enemies explode when they die, combat sounds are present, and when a club smashes the ground, you feel it.  

Fourth, the puzzles and secrets.  I don't play tons of puzzle games, but I've been enjoying the ones in HoB.  I haven't found one that has completely stumped me for ages, but they don't feel insignificant either.  Thus far, I'm finding them pretty satisfying and with a reasonable amount of variance.  I imagine this is because most of them fundamentally alter the layout of the world and for some reason being able to see the impact makes them feel good to me.  I've discovered several secret areas, and I'm sure I've missed others.  It's exciting when you find one.  You feel like a small child that has figured out how to get into cookies.  Suck it, game.

My gripes:

Fifth, the controls and camera.  In general, the controls are fluid on the controller.  Your character is responsive, turns well, and moves well in combat.  The one caveat to this is during some of the jumping puzzles.  Your character cannot turn in the air.  Once you jump, you've jumped.  I cannot tell you how many times I've jumped from one log, to the next log, clipped the edge and fallen to my death.  It is frothing-at-the-mouth-maddening.  Absolutely livid.  The veins in my neck look like the forearms of a fucking gorilla.  I shit you not, I was backtracking earlier and came to a log jump and died 8 times in a row because my stupid character can't just stick his giant bionic arm out and grab the side of a log.  First jump, wide left.  Second jump, wide right.  Ensuing jumps, all over the place.  Holy shit.  I was freaking out.  This happens a lot.  Oh, nice ladder there.  Walk up to it, expect HoB to grab it, instead go flying off the fucking cliff to my death and have to run back.  Are you kidding me with this?  COME ON, MAN.  

Which then, of course, brings me to the camera.  It's fixed, you can't move it.  Which isn't that bad, exceptt when you're behind something and literally just have no idea what your character is up to.  Whoops, "goodbye cruel world" as you parasail to your death.  Lots of weird situations where you're just running aimlessly, have no idea what's near you and then smash into something (like thorns) that hurts you.  I'm sure there are very good reasons for the camera being fixed, but be prepared to flip your shit.  Between the camera/controls while jumping, you'll be rage quitting for sure.  I've rage quit a lot.

Lastly, the performance.  Performance has been a bit of an issue for a lot of people.  Some players cannot even start the game.  Fortunately, I've avoided those severe issues.  In my time playing, I've crashed twice.  Well, my game has frozen and stopped responding, forcing me to close it out.  And you will absolutely experience stuttering in some areas/chugging in some areas regardless of your computer's power.

Overall: I've really enjoyed HoB thus far and I am looking forward to continuing to explore the World's mysteries.  I'd probably rate it 84/100, but that score would easily be in the 90s/100 if they fixed the controls and the performance issues.  The camera is only mildly irritating and mostly comounded by the controls.  The atmosphere of this game is incredible.  Pick it up.

Update: Regarding game length, it took me just under 10 hours to complete the story with roughly half of the steam achievements.  I am nowhere near completing all of the puzzles for health, energy, etc.

35227594.review: 好了，大概试玩了30分钟，写写感受吧。可能涉及一点剧透，虽然并没什么剧情。首先游戏说是在9月26号发售，实际在27号凌晨1点10分左右出现的安装界面，小水管载到1点半才下好。游戏默认可能是集显，如果你进游戏发现动画很慢，什么都很慢，就差不多是了。桌面右键英伟达控制面板，管理3D设置，改成高性能显卡就好了，反正我是这么解决的。终于正常进了游戏，画风清新，草是长方形的必须要提一句，不多作介绍，说几个要点，没有新手指导，地图不小，但没有小地图，路痴们注意了，开局大机器人放你出来，你就跟着大机器人走，操控自己慢慢摸索，和这类型的游戏都差不多，机器人走到一个环形墙那会推，你一路爬上去顺着墙走见到个畸形长颈鹿，你好奇上去然后被紫色物体沾染，大机器上来摁着你把你感染的那条胳膊砍了，我是一脸懵逼的，后面大机器把他的一条机械臂安装到你身上，恭喜你骚年，你获得了和你身体差不多大的麒麟臂，目前只知道可以用来推拉箱子，继续跟着机器走你会获得一把剑，就剑刃的宽度看来可以用来砸人，机器把你带到一个类似基地的地方，可以升级技能，最里面能融合你剑的三个碎片，让你彻底得到一个棒子？剑。出来后你会发现.......不知道该干啥了？对的，我大概摸索了五分钟，才知道要往下走，就是整片地图的下方，顺带说一句，跳崖会死的，不知道从哪砍了个类似灌汤包形状的植物得到了大概是血条碎片的东西，然后我......迷路了，嗯我到退出游戏的时候还是没明白我该干啥，依我高深的游戏理解来看，紫色的是坏的，草地上的小动物纯属装饰，我砍翻了两个也不掉东西，游戏的动作设计不僵硬但也没有很出彩，大概有许多可以摸索的地方不过更可能是我在哪？我要做什么？之类的问题。剧情抱歉我暂时没看出来，虽然我脑补了一些。总而言之这个价钱买这个游戏并不亏，起码你很无聊的情况下可以找点事做，比如琢磨下这游戏为什么连个新手指导都没，以及提一下根本没有对话及语音只有个菜单需要翻译，商店界面的支持好多国的语言和语音，你们懂得。就这样，睡觉去了。

35225857.review:
Hob is an adventure game with RPG, platforming and puzzle elements.

[h1] Video Preview [/h1]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=58tZfnYdfzk

[h1] Written Review [/h1]
The game does a great job at making you feel like you are constantly progressing. Whether it's through new enemy encounters, upgrades, new abilities or locations, you are always doing something new, which I really appreciated.

One major aspect of the game is combat. It's relatively basic, but feels quite meaty. I would compare it to Bastion. Most enemies can be killed relatively quickly through simple button mashing. Where as some larger enemies will be a bit more akin to Dark Souls. Where one swing can do massive damage, and you really need to time your dodges and attacks. However this is much more rare, and most of the combat I've encountered so far has been more like the first example.

You've got a basic attack button, where your character will go through a sword slashing combo. Another button will allow you to charge up your fist. This is needed to open cracked walls, activate heavy switches or break stone armor on enemies. It feels really cool to use. You can also do aerial attacks, and have the ability to purchase new moves like sprinting attacks, or a shield. Again, adding to a nice feeling of growing stronger.

As you play through the game you will earn major new abilities that allow you to traverse new obstacles. Such as a "warp" that allows you to traverse over huge gaps or terrain, and is needed to progress through the game or access new secret areas.

Speaking of secrets, there are a lot of them. You do a lot of platforming in this game, and if you have a keen eye, you can find a lot of different types of secrets. Either a chest that will give you a bit of extra money, or a permanent health/energy upgrade. The game is open world, so you can always retrace your steps or teleport to an older area to find missed secrets.

The third and final element of the game is puzzle solving. I would say this is the majority of the game, and it's done quite nicely. I haven't encountered anything that stumped me for ages yet, but they are tough enough to make me feel accomplished when I solve them. A lot of the times, after solving a puzzle you will open up a shortcut to a previous area, or shift the land entirely so that major areas connect. It's a really nice feeling since it gives you that feeling of long-term progression.

Onto the story. There isn't much of it. There's no text, or dialogue. There aren't many major characters, and the story isn't in your face. At the moment, I'm just doing stuff because... why not? There's a little bit of character interaction and an intro cutscene that gave me a bit of a drive to actually feel motivated to do what I'm doing, but I don't see the end goal. That's not to say that's a bad thing, I have no problem with it, but some might. There are a few "lore rooms" that you can find that will tell stories in the form of hieroglyphics, but I haven't encountered anything more than that so far.

Overall, I'm absolutely loving the game. Everything feels great. It feels like a good Zelda adventure. My only gripe is that I feel like the game can use some optimization. Even on medium graphics, on my 1060 I get frame drops quite consistently when I reveal a new area.
Other than that, I can strongly recommend the game if you like the look of it!

35225753.review:
[h1]Runic Games, die Entwickler von Torchlight I & II gehen nun mit [i]"Hob"[/i] in die nächste Runde. Und dieses Spiel dürft ihr euch auf keinen Fall entgehen lassen![/h1]

[b][u]Was erwartet euch in Hob?[/u][/b]
Hob, ein Puzzle-Adventure, das vor allem auf Erkundung und Rätsel setzt. Ihr findet euch auf einem fernen Planten wieder und könnt seine fremdartige Flora und Fauna frei erkunden. Die Geschichte erzählt sich dabei allein über die Interaktion mit der Umwelt, Dialoge oder einen Erzähler sucht ihr in "Hob" vergeblich.

In Hob gibt es sehr viele Geheimnisse zu entdecken und unter anderem geheimnisvolle Maschinen, im Inneren von Planeten zu erkunden. Ebenso lebt "Hob" sehr von seinen kleinen Rätseln, die ihr immer mal wieder, hier und da lösen müsst.

Neben den zahlreichen Geheimnissen, die nach und nach seine eigene Geschichte offenbaren, hat der Planet aber auch so seine Gefahren, die ihr versuchen müsst zu überwinden. Fiese Gegner werden euch eure Erkundung in "Hob" nicht gerade einfach machen!

[h1]Fazit - Lohnt sich Hob?[/h1]
Bei "Hob" haben sich die Entwickler sehr stark an "The Legend of Zelda" orientiert. Ihr erwacht ganz allein, als ein einsamer Held auf einem zerstörten Planeten, dessen Zivilisation von gefährlichen Gegner überrannt wurde. Ihr müsst diese ausschalten, verschiedene Arten von Puzzlen lösen und alles dafür tun um den Planeten wieder gesund zu machen.
Mein Fazit ist ganz klar: Hob lohnt sich! c:
